Author: Siti Shahroni
Review: Beautiful restaurant for small number of people. Having small event dinner with friends and so satisfied with the customer service. of course lot of western food as well malay foods for dinner. Big portion with 9/10 of taste. Will surely come again with my family.
Location: 574, Jalan Ross, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Tze Horng Tan
Review: One of the best Western restaurants in town. It is recommended to share with friends or family  as the food portion is big. The setting of the restaurant is classy and cozy. The staff is professional and attentive. As the restaurant is ‚Ä¶MoreOne of the best Western restaurants in town. It is recommended to share with friends or family  as the food portion is big. The setting of the restaurant is classy and cozy. The staff is professional and attentive. As the restaurant is located in the Kingwood Hotel, the price can be a little bit pricey than others. No booking was needed for normal dish. However, if you're interested in trying the platter then you have to book in advance. The 5 star dining experience in Miri so far.
Location: 574, Jalan Ross, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Tony Jeanes
Review: Walked past the place a few times and ventured in after reading the reviews. The place is very clean and tidy. The menu is adequate, I really fancied a steak, when I asked if they were fresh I was surprised to hear they weren't but I liked ‚Ä¶MoreWalked past the place a few times and ventured in after reading the reviews. The place is very clean and tidy. The menu is adequate, I really fancied a steak, when I asked if they were fresh I was surprised to hear they weren't but I liked the honesty. Mind you for a frozen steak it seemed expensive. I opted for the fish and chips, asked for the price of bottled beers and decided against it. The food was good, I enjoyed it, though the grated parmesan on the fish was a bit odd. Could of done with some more vegetables or salad. Staff were very friendly and all in all a positive chilled experience.
Location: 574, Jalan Ross, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Mariia Alekhina

Author: Emmielynn D
Review: This place is recommendable place for any occasions party or to have dinner with your loved ones. Credit to the friendly staffs and the chef, nice and knows what their customer  need and the food is the best!  If you never try you will never know! üòâ
Location: 574, Jalan Ross, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Food Boss
Review: Bonzer is an Australian slang for excellent, and the food at Bonzer is indeed EXCELLENT! ‚Ä¶MoreBonzer is an Australian slang for excellent, and the food at Bonzer is indeed EXCELLENT!The restaurant serves a mix of western and local dishes. The pasta dishes are very good and I would consider them as one of the best, if not the best, in Miri.The local dishes are very tasty especially the Nasi Lemak Burger. What a clever idea to serve the iconic Malaysian dish as a burger with the bun made out of rice. It reminds me of the MOS burger.The price is very reasonable as it includes the tax and service charge.Compliments to the chef and everyone at Bonzer for the amazing food experience. I will definitely come back for more.
Location: 574, Jalan Ross, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Audrius Maciulis
Review: Although we came on CNY we were rushed out the restaurant. The food was alright, wasn't too pleased with the pumpkin bisque and a simple pork cutlet with pepper sauce. The restaurant is said to be Asian fusion however it appears to be mainly Western.
Location: 574, Jalan Ross, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Bern
Review: There is a big selection of evergreen Malaysian food and a fair selection of Western food too. You can get German sausages, fish and chips, chicken chop, steak, roast lamb shank, mee goreng, nasi pataya, kueh teou goreng and more.For drinks, there are plenty of international beer, fruit juice, teh tarik, iced lemon tea and more. Bestvthing is there are good music too. They were playing 80's disco music when I was there.
Location: Borneo, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Tony Jeanes
Review: Ate here a lot over the week. Good portions good choice and really good value. Great vibe it's very popular with locals and visiting foreigners but it's certainly not the expat hang out I was dreading. Good choice of drinks from cocktails to draft and bottled beers they too were reasonable in price. Definitely worth a visit.
Location: Borneo, Miri, Sarawak

Food price are cheap as well, fried rice is like $2 dollar USD. Drink are good as well, full menu. Owner super friendly and gave us two rounds of free Jaeger bombs. Music is very good as well, the playlist from Western to 90s to Thai , again a mix.

Review: The all famous Ming Cafe of Miri is indeed popular. And of all honesty, it's pretty great. Author: Ifan Ramadhana
Review: Located in busy nightlife district in Miri, Ming Cafe is a legendary fixture of Miri and almost go to places for tourist, cafe is a rather loose term since they are more of a bar and pub at night. ‚Ä¶MoreLocated in busy nightlife district in Miri, Ming Cafe is a legendary fixture of Miri and almost go to places for tourist, cafe is a rather loose term since they are more of a bar and pub at night.They don't have direct parking spaces and you had to park your vehicles and walk to the premises, during the day they do function as a quiet cafe and bar, while you can have lunch and drink. They offered Asian and Western food/snacks and very complete selection of liquors, they have open non smoking area and closed AC room.At night however the place turn into wild club, with almost full table and live dj music, they also often had themed night and promotion, you just need to ask the waiter for the prmotion, they still served food all night as well. Mind you that the place can get little rowdy with tight space and a lot of drunk people. They still serves good drink though, also they had excellent range of souvenirs to take home with you. Like many crowded places, the toilet can be quite smelly and full of drunk people.Overall this place is good if you like nightlife and party, but in the day this place also offers good food.
Location: Borneo, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Cynthia R

Author: Kristian Kho
Review: Ming Cafe is the place to mingle if you are ever in Miri, Malaysia.It's actually a combination of a Bistro, Bar, and Restaurant. Each with its own ‚Ä¶MoreMing Cafe is the place to mingle if you are ever in Miri, Malaysia.It's actually a combination of a Bistro, Bar, and Restaurant. Each with its own cordoned section. Right in the center of Miri Town.I personally visit the Bistro part of Ming Cafe. But families can visit their air-conditioned Restaurant which serves various types of cuisine including Local, Oriental, Malay (non-halal), even Western. And the party goers can Club around the bar section, crowded, loud, smoky, if you're into that kind of atmosphere. I personally don't go there because it's not what I like.They serve a large range of alcohols, wines, and cocktails. And the vibe is cool too, generally loud but still quite chill.I highly suggest this place for visitors, tourist or expats staying in Miri. It's the closest one can get to a legit bistro in Miri.*copied from my original review on Steemit.
Location: Borneo, Miri, Sarawak

Author: bluefalcon5537
Review: I really like their food and their service. But one thing that really bothers me is their indecisiveness on when they want to open. We asked the staff what time they open and they told us at 12. But when we arrived back close to 1pm they ‚Ä¶MoreI really like their food and their service. But one thing that really bothers me is their indecisiveness on when they want to open. We asked the staff what time they open and they told us at 12. But when we arrived back close to 1pm they told us they will open at 1:30pm. But that was not the case a couple of days ago, when they were open at 12. On google they have hours listed as 10am-3am. Thats Really really confusing. Please decide on the time you want to open everyday and stick with it. We can't read your mind.

Author: Yong Kiat Lee
Review: So so good!! Okay, let me digest it for you all. Read some reviews and came to try. Ordered teh tarik, cheese naan and butter chicken. The place is clean overall but really recomended to sit outside. Teh tarik came first, it smells and ‚Ä¶MoreSo so good!! Okay, let me digest it for you all. Read some reviews and came to try. Ordered teh tarik, cheese naan and butter chicken. The place is clean overall but really recomended to sit outside. Teh tarik came first, it smells and taste good. A bit like goat milk but i cant say. Cheese naan and butter chicken came right after. It took less than 10mins for all dishes to be served. Cheese naan is okay, not super but average. However topped with butter chicken it tasted fantastic. I would definitely go for second. Briyani was good according to the waitress but i only had one stomach. Shall come again next time. Give it a go guys!!
Location: Lot 229 Ground Floor, Jalan Maju, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Will √Ökerlund
Review: Superb service at amazing prices!I always try to go the the nr 1 cheap eats wherever I go, and this place ‚Ä¶MoreSuperb service at amazing prices!I always try to go the the nr 1 cheap eats wherever I go, and this place represents exactly why.Friendly and very helpful staff although I was being difficult ordering, not knowing what I wanted or what things were. Ended up with some kind of crepe (roti), curry and rice with vegetables and a sweet yogurt drink I tried on recommendation, although I had a feeling it wouldn't suit my taste. Loved the entire experience and though I didn't like the drink at first it grew on me and I'm glad I tried it!I paid:3rm for chicken curry4rm for rice incl. veggies4rm cheese crepe (plain is 1rn!!)5rm for the drink, which is their most expensive oneGoing back tonight for another curry and a couple of crepes!
Location: Lot 229 Ground Floor, Jalan Maju, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Jamie Furlong
Review: Between two of us we ordered four different veggie curry dishes. They all tasted the same. Little imagination or care involved in the preparation here. If you want a genuine Indian experience, Tandoori Corner beats this place hands down.
Location: Lot 229 Ground Floor, Jalan Maju, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Tony Jeanes
Review: The place is easy to find, Google maps has it nailed, which for Miri is something. The eatery is very basic, the staff were very friendly, the old man could have smiled but hey. The menu offers a range of Indian style food alongside more ‚Ä¶MoreThe place is easy to find, Google maps has it nailed, which for Miri is something. The eatery is very basic, the staff were very friendly, the old man could have smiled but hey. The menu offers a range of Indian style food alongside more traditional Malaysian. The chicken vindaloo is what grabbed my attention from researching the place on Maps. That was quickly ordered along with tarka dahl and garlic naan, washed down with a mango lassi. Didn't go for rice, why waste the space. The food is prepared to order, the drink was refreshing and not too thick, then after a wait of around 15 minutes, which I was pleased knowing that the food was being prepared and not just scooped out of a container. The chicken vindaloo I ordered to be spicy, it was really nice, tasty and not oily, good range of flavours, could have been a little spicier for my tastes. The dahl was awesome, nice and thick, with loads of flavours, good to see that they put in blackened dried red chillies, just how I like it. The bread too was very good, thought it looked a bit dry when I first saw it, but I was wrong, plenty of garlic and they were just right. Now I've found this place I will certainly be back.
Location: Lot 229 Ground Floor, Jalan Maju, Miri, Sarawak

Review: Great little spot in Miri. Enjoyed their salted egg crab, sambal midin, and see cucumber soup! The owner stopped by to check in on us because over ordered for 3 adults but demolished almost everything except a small takeaway container of ‚Ä¶MoreGreat little spot in Miri. Enjoyed their salted egg crab, sambal midin, and see cucumber soup! The owner stopped by to check in on us because over ordered for 3 adults but demolished almost everything except a small takeaway container of roasted pork. Special thanks to my cousin for showing us around! Follow my adventures IG @blingless
Location: Jalan Yu Seng, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Going Keep
Review: The flavor is very good without too salty. I like the fried riced very much with proper savory and caramelized flavor. The fat of pork belly is really melted in your mouse. The only little cons is lean meat is a little bit dry. I think the ‚Ä¶MoreThe flavor is very good without too salty. I like the fried riced very much with proper savory and caramelized flavor. The fat of pork belly is really melted in your mouse. The only little cons is lean meat is a little bit dry. I think the good point is not too salty compared to other zi char store. Must visit again if come Miri next time.
Location: Jalan Yu Seng, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Kelvin Webb
Review: Excellent seafood. So glad we came here, we had stopped in another one up the road but when they didn't have razor clams and the atmosphere felt a bit subdued we went back to Apollo and had or dinner there. ‚Ä¶MoreExcellent seafood. So glad we came here, we had stopped in another one up the road but when they didn't have razor clams and the atmosphere felt a bit subdued we went back to Apollo and had or dinner there.Black pepper prawns, razor clams in dry curry, Sichuan tofu and some green vegetable stuff which I never know which is which ite what is what. Couple of beers all for $100! Food was spot on.
Location: Jalan Yu Seng, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Faybie Bungin
Review: One of the best seafood restaurant in Miri, always have the freshest seafood in town. Their food never disappoint you and they always maintain their food quality since the first time we have dinner here.  My family and I has been a loyal customer for about 10 years.
Location: Jalan Yu Seng, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Matthew Nyambang
Review: Been coming here for years now ever since I was a young kid. I've always loved the dining experiences that I had with my family. The service is acceptable, the menu is quite vast, friendly staffs, prices are justified and the food is just ‚Ä¶MoreBeen coming here for years now ever since I was a young kid. I've always loved the dining experiences that I had with my family. The service is acceptable, the menu is quite vast, friendly staffs, prices are justified and the food is just comforting and nice. My family enjoyed it and I enjoyed it just as much. Verdict: Apollo Seafood Restaurant offers that classic Sarawakian seafood restaurant vibe that people enjoy with their families through the taste of their food and their friendly service and thus a thumbs up!
Location: Jalan Yu Seng, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Jonah Lee
Review: Cash only. Rough dining. No air conditioning. Cooling by fans. Place is unkempt. Seats and tables aren't exactly clean. So are the plastic plates, bowls and chopsticks. Forks and spoons are flimsy though they are supposedly made of ‚Ä¶MoreCash only. Rough dining. No air conditioning. Cooling by fans. Place is unkempt. Seats and tables aren't exactly clean. So are the plastic plates, bowls and chopsticks. Forks and spoons are flimsy though they are supposedly made of stainless steel. Dinning here, you have to caste hygiene to the wind. The locals don't complain. In fact they like the food which is really quite good. Having said this you aren't likely to suffer food poisoning or diarrhoea; though the risks are there. Prices are reasonable. Not cheap by local standards.
Location: Jalan Yu Seng, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Example, I ordered nasi growing chicken, the rice has taste, the chicken has only few pieces and they are chicken breast and they have no vegetable. Like plain rice fried with ‚Ä¶MoreThe food here is taste fine, but the food content is very less. Example, I ordered nasi growing chicken, the rice has taste, the chicken has only few pieces and they are chicken breast and they have no vegetable. Like plain rice fried with some curry powder... And the price so expensive! Totally doesn't enjoy and the place is very hot, the air is not ventilated, because the kitchen is right in front in the lobby dining area. Overall not so good experience.

Author: Mufaddal Zanzibarwala
Review: Very nice place and the owner came and greeted us.Our food was made to order so came nice and hot. ‚Ä¶MoreVery nice place and the owner came and greeted us.Our food was made to order so came nice and hot.Had chicken masala and naan. Author: Jothinathan Muniandy
Review: Visited twice... Open till 4am for world cup...Had snack even till late morning. Sweet potato fries however wasnt good. Not fried well. ‚Ä¶MoreVisited twice... Open till 4am for world cup...Had snack even till late morning. Sweet potato fries however wasnt good. Not fried well.Lunch was great, huge portion and awesome ambience. Fairly priced. Staffs are helpful and excellent service.
Location: Lot 1948 & 1949, Ground Floor, Jalan Temenggong Oyong Lawai Jau,, Marina Square Phase 2,, Miri, Sarawak

Author: KaiiNii
Review: Atmosphere, service, and dish were all superb. Loved the green tea, it serves well to clean your palates after having your ramen to taste the fresh flavours of salmon sashimi next. ‚Ä¶MoreAtmosphere, service, and dish were all superb. Loved the green tea, it serves well to clean your palates after having your ramen to taste the fresh flavours of salmon sashimi next.The ones I had was the Miso Ramen.. I was actually hoping to have a bowl of Tonkotsu Ramen but it appears this place didn't serve any other than the Miso broth.. could it be added into the menu sometime in the future?By the way, are those the real wasabi? as in the thing itself? It doesn't sting like your standard instant wasabi paste which is purely horse radish. If it is, a very very big thumbs up because it's what I've been yearning to taste in my life.I'd recommend this place for a good ramen lunch/dinner. Would definitely come again!
Location: Lot 1948 & 1949, Ground Floor, Jalan Temenggong Oyong Lawai Jau,, Marina Square Phase 2,, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Siew Ling L
Review: Friendly staff and good dining ambience. Ordered the spicy tantanmen and yaki soba.Spicy tantanmen: moderate spiciness, can choose between ramen noodles and thin ‚Ä¶MoreFriendly staff and good dining ambience. Ordered the spicy tantanmen and yaki soba.Spicy tantanmen: moderate spiciness, can choose between ramen noodles and thin noodles. Tried the ramen noodles, nice. The soup is pretty rich and creamy. Overall this dish is good.Yaki soba: chose the seafood type. Delicious. Prefer the yaki soba over spicy tantanmen.A bit disappointed when we were told the Kare ramen isn‚Äôt available. Also, I wish they can add tonkotsu ramen into the menu.Price is reasonable. Big portion.
Location: Lot 1948 & 1949, Ground Floor, Jalan Temenggong Oyong Lawai Jau,, Marina Square Phase 2,, Miri, Sarawak

Author: daniel tan
Review: Lousy food and not cheap. Ordered gyudon (beef rice) the food was tasteless and wasnt fresh, beef was overcooked and extremely tough. Also ordered california sushi, what came out wasnt even same with the picture. In the picture they had the ‚Ä¶MoreLousy food and not cheap. Ordered gyudon (beef rice) the food was tasteless and wasnt fresh, beef was overcooked and extremely tough. Also ordered california sushi, what came out wasnt even same with the picture. In the picture they had the small red tobiko on the sushi but instead was substituted by some grains? When i asked the waiter why was it so its because the tobiko expires quickly... but i was hungry already so i took it anyways and it was lousy regardless. But ambience is really nice just the food sucks.
Location: Lot 1948 & 1949, Ground Floor, Jalan Temenggong Oyong Lawai Jau,, Marina Square Phase 2,, Miri, Sarawak

Author: yc liew
Review: Had tsukemen. The noodle was served super hot where the menu written cold noodle. Waitress told me it was supposed to served hot, and I was confused as it was completely different from what I had in Japan. The noodle tasted weird, abit like ‚Ä¶MoreHad tsukemen. The noodle was served super hot where the menu written cold noodle. Waitress told me it was supposed to served hot, and I was confused as it was completely different from what I had in Japan. The noodle tasted weird, abit like over cooked on the outside and still raw on the inside. Soup is tasteless and when you eat with the noodle you actually taste nothing other than plain noodle. Had to ask the waitress whether I can change the tsukemen to gyudon. The gyudon was ok. Two stars for the waitress who exchange my food for me.

Author: Diving VJ
Review: So many dishes, so many choices. If you are unfamiliar with kelabit / native dishes the choices might be a bit daunting. Best to go with someone who knows what to order. Its always crowded so go in early. Delicious food that you can explore.
Location: 1246, 1238, Jalan Melayu, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Molly Cher
Review: A fast food business selling Kelabit food. A great assortment of vegetables and a few choices of fish and meat. The cafe can get rather hot as you're eating your meal as there's hardly any moving air. But the food are quite tasty and moderately priced.
Location: 1246, 1238, Jalan Melayu, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Racheal
Review: Love the ulu food! Too bad the nasi bungkus sold out. Love the kasam babi, daun ubi, daun timun and there are so much more varieties of dishes they prepared. The cafe beside also serving ulu food.
Location: 1246, 1238, Jalan Melayu, Miri, Sarawak

Author: The Choobs
Review: One of the most epic eateries in Miri. Unique Bario ala Kelabit cuisine with taste which really tantalizes your taste buds. Textures, flavor and ingredients that is very different than your usual South East Asian food. Kind of an eye opener ‚Ä¶MoreOne of the most epic eateries in Miri. Unique Bario ala Kelabit cuisine with taste which really tantalizes your taste buds. Textures, flavor and ingredients that is very different than your usual South East Asian food. Kind of an eye opener for asian foodies.Order your dishes with 'Numa Laya' (hope I spell that right) a rice mashed wrapped in fragrant leave.
Location: 1246, 1238, Jalan Melayu, Miri, Sarawak

Author: David Jr
Review: Truly the best Kelabit Food in Sarawak, and probably the world. If you are looking for some authentic Sarawak Ethnic Highland Food, this is the place to try. Come here just before lunch to avoid the crowds. Highly recommended for any food lovers.
Location: 1246, 1238, Jalan Melayu, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Jason Lau
Review: Great kelabit local food. Wide range of dishes to choose from. Nasi Lemak is nice too.
Location: 1246, 1238, Jalan Melayu, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Georgina Wan
Review: This cafe provide home-cook food as in our home.  My family frequented this cafe when the man of the house is in town.  There are varieties of vege and other meat and fish menus.  The rice is either cooked as usual and there is also a ‚Ä¶MoreThis cafe provide home-cook food as in our home.  My family frequented this cafe when the man of the house is in town.  There are varieties of vege and other meat and fish menus.  The rice is either cooked as usual and there is also a choice of soft rice wrap in leaves.   Most days, the shop owner also offer fried glutinous (pulut) rice balls.

Author: Esther Kim88
Review: Excelents. Its was one of this place kelabit foods from bario. And the foods is very delicues. Also nuba laya its very famouse in sarawak esspecialy in bario or miri town. Also nuba laya its very famouse in sarawak esspecialy in bario or miri town. You should to come and try it when you come to visit miri or bario. Original kelabit from kampung Pa Lungan,Bario. Location: 1246, 1238, Jalan Melayu, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Stzu Heng Voon
Review: The most attracting part is the Orang Ulu food found here. Orang Ulu is the general term for the indigenous tribes of the mountains of Northern Sarawak. The food is great and seldom available elsewhere. But in the vinicity of summit, there ‚Ä¶MoreThe most attracting part is the Orang Ulu food found here. Orang Ulu is the general term for the indigenous tribes of the mountains of Northern Sarawak. The food is great and seldom available elsewhere. But in the vinicity of summit, there are 3 more orang ulu food stalls I give it tumb up, visitors or tourists to Miri should taste this indigenous food.
Location: 1246, 1238, Jalan Melayu, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Jennifer Joseph

Author: Goh Chyou
Review: Madli is one of the best satay restaurant in Miri area. A traditional satay recipe inherited from his Father in law and is still original. ‚Ä¶MoreMadli is one of the best satay restaurant in Miri area. A traditional satay recipe inherited from his Father in law and is still original.Most of the workers in here are of his family members and dinning here really feels like at home. Fairly fast service and very friendly atmosphere.The price also reasonable and many other dishes that you can try.
Location: Ground Floor, Lot 1088, Jalan Merpati, Miri, Sarawak

Author: NORIZAH NOOR

Author: Bob Webster David
Review: This is my first visit to this restaurant. I have a mixed feeling about the foods. For Nasi Kerabu, usually the main Ingredient for nasi kerabu is "budu" (anchovies sauce), there is none. The taste of budu is a must in nasi kerabu. As for ‚Ä¶MoreThis is my first visit to this restaurant. I have a mixed feeling about the foods. For Nasi Kerabu, usually the main Ingredient for nasi kerabu is "budu" (anchovies sauce), there is none. The taste of budu is a must in nasi kerabu. As for nasi lemak, the rice is quite sticky but the sambal is good. Fried chicken is quite dry on the inside.The main star items of Madli's are their satay and i did not have the chance to order one. Maybe for my next visit.
Location: Ground Floor, Lot 1088, Jalan Merpati, Miri, Sarawak

Author: E. D.
Review: Worst service I've ever seen.Waiting for 15 minutes and not getting a menu. I've eaten here two days before ‚Ä¶MoreWorst service I've ever seen.Waiting for 15 minutes and not getting a menu. I've eaten here two days before and it took some minutes until the service arrived. That was already bad, but still okay.But today there is no menu coming.I've been two weeks in West Malaysia and two weeks in Sarawak and this is just a catastrophe.I think they should get either more people or organize their stuff more efficiently. The staff seems to have to much to do.The food itself is okay though (two days before). But due to the bad service I recommend any other place around this area as the Muara.
Location: Ground Floor, Lot 1088, Jalan Merpati, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Johan Shaik
Review: Incredibly horrible place. Staff not friendly and took over 20 mins to take my order. After I ordered they came back to try to tell me they had no French fries for my 4 year old son. They could not explain in English so I asked them to ‚Ä¶MoreIncredibly horrible place. Staff not friendly and took over 20 mins to take my order. After I ordered they came back to try to tell me they had no French fries for my 4 year old son. They could not explain in English so I asked them to explain in Bahasa Malay. Basically they had no fries because nobody ordered it from the supplier. I asked them for a cheese sandwich (which was not on the menu) for my son. But they just shrugged and ignored the question. This went on for 2 or 3 mins. I got fed up and cancelled my order and left. Disgraceful. The worst family run restaurant where the family was not there.
Location: Ground Floor, Lot 1088, Jalan Merpati, Miri, Sarawak

Review: Food is consistent at both Miri and Lutong branched. Their buffet lunch or 'nasi campur' is tasty and variety meets the heart desires all the time. Serves both local and western for dinner but recommend local dishes over western. My Johor ‚Ä¶MoreFood is consistent at both Miri and Lutong branched. Their buffet lunch or 'nasi campur' is tasty and variety meets the heart desires all the time. Serves both local and western for dinner but recommend local dishes over western. My Johor friends recommend the Mee Jawa. Mee kolok ayam is quite popular too. They open tables by the happening pavement across the mall in Miri at night. The Lutong branch has some duo performing , basking some nights. Toilets and restaurant well kept.

Author: Razali Osman
Review: Seafood restaurant.. Served steam prawn, fish, butter prawn. All fresh from the sea.. Pricing are moderate.. Enjoy your food with sea breeze as the restaurant is near the sea side.
Location: Lot 7682, Bakam Road, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Rueben Jacob
Review: The food is nice. Was here for corporate function. The red fish, cook with nyonya style is nice but can be nicer if the sauce to be thicker & more spicy a bit more. The  butter crab, prawn & cuttle fish, really spot on! The vege is nice, ‚Ä¶MoreThe food is nice. Was here for corporate function. The red fish, cook with nyonya style is nice but can be nicer if the sauce to be thicker & more spicy a bit more. The  butter crab, prawn & cuttle fish, really spot on! The vege is nice, love the midin umai! Must have. Be reminded that mosquito is around, hope the restaurant can do better to reduce it by putting the mosquito repellent.
Location: Lot 7682, Bakam Road, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Review: Okeyyyy..fresh seafood     U alls must tryyy !!!

Author: Gurjit Samra
Review: One the best quality seafood in Miri City. Food was cooked well and tasted great. The management followed the COVID-19 SOP while I was there with my family. Warm and friendly staff. The only thing I would like to improve is the layout of ‚Ä¶MoreOne the best quality seafood in Miri City. Food was cooked well and tasted great. The management followed the COVID-19 SOP while I was there with my family. Warm and friendly staff. The only thing I would like to improve is the layout of the floor plan. It's a bit inconvenient to access the wash area because there's only one entrance and exit.
Location: Lot 7682, Bakam Road, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Author: ALICE Wu
Review: Nice place to dine in, with air-conditioning or open space to choose. Reservation is required during festive period.

Author: Chun-Yeow Yeoh
Review: A typical seafood restaurant with fresh fish, prawn and crab to choose for. The cooking style is kind of similar to a lot of restaurants surrounding Miri. The distance is a bit far from center Miri. Overall can give a try if you would like to look for sunset at the beach.
Location: Lot 7682, Bakam Road, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Abu Bakar
Review: Nice food and I rate it 5 ‚≠ê Thank you and i will come again.
Location: Lot 7682, Bakam Road, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Jacky Chai
Review: Not bad..fresh enough for the seafood
Location: Lot 7682, Bakam Road, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Chew Yee Ng
Review: Seafood place that locals will drive 10km from the city to have their seafood fix. For a foreigner, the traveling was worth it. The seafood is extremely fresh and sweet. Enjoying the sea breeze and sunset with dinner is an extreme delight. ‚Ä¶MoreSeafood place that locals will drive 10km from the city to have their seafood fix. For a foreigner, the traveling was worth it. The seafood is extremely fresh and sweet. Enjoying the sea breeze and sunset with dinner is an extreme delight. The staff are extremely helpful and transparent about their price before ordering, this is greatly appreciated. We did have some trouble getting back to the city but no fear, the staff manage to get us a cab when grab failed after we tried for 30min.
Location: Lot 7682, Bakam Road, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Aaron Lai Chee Seng
Review: Good food. Highly recommended
Location: Lot 7682, Bakam Road, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Nicole Tan
Review: Nice food, taste good, friendly and helpful staff plus fast serving. We love seafood at miri, price are reasonable. Easily to get car park here, it was a huge car park area just in front of the restaurant. You can choose with or without air condition. We prefer with air condition meaning less mosquito lol
Location: Lot 7682, Bakam Road, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Ajimsimbom
Review: This is a sea side restaurant, it has a romantic location where u can take a walk with your family by the sea shore after a meal. Lots of variety of sea food stuff and the staff and waiters are so lovely and friendly and professional. ‚Ä¶MoreThis is a sea side restaurant, it has a romantic location where u can take a walk with your family by the sea shore after a meal. Lots of variety of sea food stuff and the staff and waiters are so lovely and friendly and professional. However,good food deserves a reasonable pay too,just to mean,the food is not cheap but it is affordable. I strongly recommend Dragon sea food restaurant for sea food lovers
Location: Lot 7682, Bakam Road, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Masin Talanana
Review: Their fish is fresh as it's still swimming around when you enter. They really cook to order. Also, their fried rice is really good too. You should really go here if you want to have good fish, shellfish and crustaceans (prawn, lobster, etc.)
Location: Lot 7682, Bakam Road, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Damaris
Review: Went on a weekday night, the service was fast, the workers were friendly. The food was great too. It's pricey but that is already expected. I just wish they had proper menu for customers to choose from right from the dining table.
Location: Lot 7682, Bakam Road, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Eleen Chan
Review: We ordered 2kg steam crab and we saw them took and weight it. But when they dished out the crab, one of it has unfresh smell. Told the crew and they claimed that it is normal the crab smelled like that. They treated us like we haven't or ‚Ä¶MoreWe ordered 2kg steam crab and we saw them took and weight it. But when they dished out the crab, one of it has unfresh smell. Told the crew and they claimed that it is normal the crab smelled like that. They treated us like we haven't or never eaten crab before. Another thing is never order their jug juices. We ordered watermelon juice and it costed RM 45 per jug! So always ask the price before ordering.
Location: Lot 7682, Bakam Road, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Abdul razak Abdullah

Author: Vince Y
Review: There‚Äôs not much changes to the place except for the new retro picture frames on the wall which brings back sweet memories.. Ambience is still dark as the lights were not switched on even at the counter (..to conserve energy?) ‚Ä¶MoreThere‚Äôs not much changes to the place except for the new retro picture frames on the wall which brings back sweet memories.. Author: Lee Chin

Location: Lor 284G, Jalan Brighton, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Amanda Ho
Review: (Situation: Came with friends who ordered but I did not)Disappointed in the way they treated customers. They were nice to those who order food but they "kicked out" those who don't, and they use SOP as a reason for ‚Ä¶More(Situation: Came with friends who ordered but I did not)Disappointed in the way they treated customers. They were nice to those who order food but they "kicked out" those who don't, and they use SOP as a reason for such action. I will understand if they would want those who don't order to be excuse from the shop, BUT I am truly DISAPPOINTED in the way they told us to leave, it was very rude. They pointed at the door signaling us to leave. Such a shame of them to have good food but bad service.

Author: Hermione Chui
Review: Just went there with my friends after school. I didn't felt like eating but just to accompany my friends. I told the cashier (owner) I didn't want to order since he asked what should I wanted order. Immediately he asked me to leave the ‚Ä¶MoreJust went there with my friends after school. I didn't felt like eating but just to accompany my friends. I told the cashier (owner) I didn't want to order since he asked what should I wanted order. Immediately he asked me to leave the restaurant with a bad attitude because I'm not ordering, also saying , "This is SOP". There was no statement in SOP saying that customers are not allowed to come and stay without ordering food. (If I'm not wrong, as a customer, I have the right to not order among my friends if I don't feel like it) I would understand if it's your own restaurant rule that whoever doesn't order shall not have the rights to stay since we are not ordering anything, but 1) I came with a group not as an individual 2) abusing the title SOP. If it's your own restaurant rule then it is then so your own restaurant rule, NOT UNDER THE SOP RULE. There were some SOP's they weren't following either and I would not like to state it here. Additionally, they asked me to leave in a very rude matter, pointing the exit and asked me to leave, embarrassed me in front of my friends and the other customer. I, on the other hand did not felt ashamed however very very disappointed as he was bias towards my friends because they bought food and treated them very nice unlike me just accompanying my friends and not ordering food. Very very disappointed.
Location: Lor 284G, Jalan Brighton, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Gurjit Samra
Review: If you're a true Mirian, you'll know all about the Open Air Fried Kueh Tiaw. Hearty, cheap and delicious. They start operating around 2 a.m till breakfast is over. Either have it after having a good night out or if you're up for an early ‚Ä¶MoreIf you're a true Mirian, you'll know all about the Open Air Fried Kueh Tiaw. Hearty, cheap and delicious. They start operating around 2 a.m till breakfast is over. Either have it after having a good night out or if you're up for an early breakfast. I personally like to drench my Fried Kueh Tiaw in the chilli sauce that they provide. It gives a bit of spicy and it brings it all together. The food is delicious but the surrounding is a lack in hygiene but that's the council's responsibility.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Mike Chan

Author: Benedict Jong

Author: Kristian Kho
Review: This place perfectly encapsulates the "Old Town Vibes". It's for those that don't mind too much on an establishment being squeaky clean and wants to taste nostalgia of the 80's,70's.. Maybe even 60's of Miri. I guess the term is Timeless. ‚Ä¶MoreThis place perfectly encapsulates the "Old Town Vibes". It's for those that don't mind too much on an establishment being squeaky clean and wants to taste nostalgia of the 80's,70's.. Maybe even 60's of Miri. I guess the term is Timeless.One Stall that I recommend the most has got to be the Curry Chicken and stewed Pork rice. An all time classic by the town wide famous "Aunties" that had been running their business for almost 40 years now.The plate is rich with the aroma of coconut curry, the scent of boiled chicken, and the smooth texture of the stewed pork.One caveat though, just sit nearby their Stall "Stall No. 6" and wait for them to take your order, tell them you want "1 plate" and that's it. Talk anymore and you'll risk a barrage of scoldings because that's just how they are... For the past 40 years.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Vanessa Sim
Review: Uncomfortable dining place but food is delicious especially the kai chook, chicken and konlau mee stall manned by a bunch of bros and 2 sisters. Fantastic memory they have without looking at you when u order but fantastically they serve all ‚Ä¶MoreUncomfortable dining place but food is delicious especially the kai chook, chicken and konlau mee stall manned by a bunch of bros and 2 sisters. Fantastic memory they have without looking at you when u order but fantastically they serve all correctly! Have to come real early n wait patiently for your food without complaining about them being served late! Such is their way of doing business but despite their arrogance, people are still willing to eat at their stall n 'bear with it'!

But I assure you this is one of the best biryani food you can get in Miri. After the main course if you are still not too full, I strongly recommend you to try their desserts menu. For me, the attentive friendly staff just made the meal perfect. Hope they will do well because every time I visited, only 30 to 40% occupancy...

Author: Matthew Nyambang
Review: Food was okay but i wasnt entirely blown away by it because i was expecting REAL SPICY-authentic Indian cuisine, which wasnt entirely the case. My keema and Biryani were okay, possibly the best ive had in Miri, but it somehow lacked the ‚Ä¶MoreFood was okay but i wasnt entirely blown away by it because i was expecting REAL SPICY-authentic Indian cuisine, which wasnt entirely the case. My keema and Biryani were okay, possibly the best ive had in Miri, but it somehow lacked the "oomph" factor (Spice) that is present in real Indian cuisine. However, the ambience was cozy and warm, staffs were attentive and service was good. Bottom of the line, Biryani Art offers dishes that are closest to the real deal here in Miri.
Location: Pelita Commercial Centre, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Wade Fox
Review: I used to come here once or twice a week. Early or no place to park and have to play chair. The waiter and waitress are too busy with their own work. No one to show me to my table or care how long I have to wait for me to have an order. ‚Ä¶MoreI used to come here once or twice a week. Early or no place to park and have to play chair. The waiter and waitress are too busy with their own work. No one to show me to my table or care how long I have to wait for me to have an order. Only, brute force is the way.Dimsum - Not like it used to be. Mostly are overcooked and, be careful if you try those pandan chicken. Some will have extra stick poked inside. New dishes are introduced. But they do not have the quality of their price. just fancy looking food. And this 2 years, food quality has become pale. Pale is although different dimsums are ordered. Everything taste almost the same. Maybe they use the same sauce or my taste bud is bland. But I would still recommend to my friends because of their price. Just don't pick those fancy colored instant cold food such as mocchi, pudding etc
Location: 2450-2452, Jalan Dato Permaisuri, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Tang CM
Review: Delicious food at a reasonable price. Courteous and helpful staff. Clean restaurant with a classic Chinese culture environment. It would be even better if there's soft background Chinese classical music. My family and I just love this ‚Ä¶MoreDelicious food at a reasonable price. Courteous and helpful staff. Clean restaurant with a classic Chinese culture environment. It would be even better if there's soft background Chinese classical music. My family and I just love this place. It's our breakfast and lunch haunt. It's a restaurant that I will never miss bringing my overseas friends for meals. THUMBS UP.
Location: 2450-2452, Jalan Dato Permaisuri, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Hwa Fan Lai
Review: The food and the ambience in the restaurant are good. Not many customers queueing for seats even though it is public holiday. ‚Ä¶MoreThe food and the ambience in the restaurant are good. Not many customers queueing for seats even though it is public holiday.However, it'd be better if one of the staff acts as seat manager and coordinate seating based on whoever arrived first and the number of people in a group, rather than everyone just go in and stand beside the table waiting and staring at the ppl enjoying their food wondering when they will finish eating and leave. It does feel like u are eating under stress.
Location: 2450-2452, Jalan Dato Permaisuri, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Mika A
Review: When I first came here, it was because of my dim sum craving. Unfortunately, it was at night and they don't serve it at night. Hence, I tried on their Wat Tan Hor, and it was great. Many times had l attempt to look for Wat Tan Hor that had ‚Ä¶MoreWhen I first came here, it was because of my dim sum craving. Unfortunately, it was at night and they don't serve it at night. Hence, I tried on their Wat Tan Hor, and it was great. Many times had l attempt to look for Wat Tan Hor that had the ultimate taste similar to what my imagination could tell me (Wat Tan Hor similar like Sandakan's), and bingo! I found it at Lao Yang. Moreover, their Wheatgrass C and 3 Layer Tea taste just as good as I wanted it to be. On top of that, I came here for another time to have a try on their dim sum (alone) - I ate a lot, and it didn't disappoint me at all. From that moment, it became one of my starred eating places. Even, then environment is soothing and calming plus quite traditional looking - which I enjoyed as a solo eater traveler. On the other hand, I tried their pork chop and it was deliberately excellent to. To this day, none of the food that I ordered by instinct made me sad. I love to eat and I find happiness in eating. When my tummy is happy, my person is happy. I just visited again last night for another round of Wat Tan Hor, and Wheatgrass C, and like always, I'm satisfied and contented. Definitely will pay many more visits to here, be it alone, or in a group (of non-Muslims). ‚ù§Ô∏è
Location: 2450-2452, Jalan Dato Permaisuri, Miri, Sarawak

The dim sums come in carts, where they are pushed around by attendants, much like ‚Ä¶MoreDoes good dim sums in the morning. This restaurant is almost always full during weekend mornings. If you want to have a taste of their dim sums, go early. The dim sums come in carts, where they are pushed around by attendants, much like what you can find in HK. Author: Hillary Hart
Review: Warm welcoming by the staff. Staff offered us to place the drink first at the counter before taking the seat. As we just walk-in about 4pm, there was another 3 groups of people in the cafe and we had no problem to get the table for 2 adults ‚Ä¶MoreWarm welcoming by the staff. Staff offered us to place the drink first at the counter before taking the seat. As we just walk-in about 4pm, there was another 3 groups of people in the cafe and we had no problem to get the table for 2 adults and 2 kids. Waiting time for the food to come just reasonable. The food was good and get what we paid for. Dish as shown in picture quite nice. Definetely will come again, this is my second visit.
Location: No A-G18, Miri Times Square, Marina Parkcity, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Yong Kiat Lee
Review: Came on Saturday around 2pm and the cafe is quite full. Managed to secure a small table of 2 and ordered one of the elixir, the 2 layer exquisite burger and beef flatbread. The ambient and deco of the cafe is tiptop as commented by the rest ‚Ä¶MoreCame on Saturday around 2pm and the cafe is quite full. Managed to secure a small table of 2 and ordered one of the elixir, the 2 layer exquisite burger and beef flatbread. The ambient and deco of the cafe is tiptop as commented by the rest of 5 stars. But we all came here to eat and not just to enjoy the view so food is the one that degraded it to 2 stars. The elixir drinks, first on menu (forgot the name cz not worth memorising) tasted like bandung topped with 5 dried roses. Not much to describe on the taste but yea, it's below average. Next come the beef flatbread. The flatbread was nice and crunchy, but the beef still have bits of bones left on it. I don't think anyone would think the meat on flatbread having any bones so if you are reading this and wanted to try flatbread, just be careful when eating them. Last but not least the burger, also forgotten the name but it is the featured one on the menu with one layer of fried breaded patty with beef stuffing and beef patty. Not gonna lie, the plating of the burger is stunning. However, the burger is just too dry. The fried patty is dry, the grilled patty is dry as well. The aftertaste is also quite oily and not pleasant. As for the salad, I would describe it as chunks of cabbage with tasteless mayo. I really hope it is only my table that has that kind of dissapointing salad. Overall, would come to hang if friends invited but would not come on my own will unless they really look into their food quality.Ps: I think there is another review that said it already, but yeah, their toilet sink is so so special.
Location: No A-G18, Miri Times Square, Marina Parkcity, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Edgaras Katinas
Review: Definitely a 10/10 for the deco and the ambiance! The decor is really nice and classy! ‚Ä¶MoreDefinitely a 10/10 for the deco and the ambiance! The decor is really nice and classy!What did we have?ü•™Grilled pulled pork paniniü•ûCr√™pes SuzetteThe crepes come with a show! They will prepare them in front of you. It creates a nice experience as it isn‚Äôt common to see the food being prepared and plated in front of you. üòçThe taste of the cr√™pes was really good! The orange flavours were well-pronounced and blend really well with the alcohol flavours, butter, lemon, and sugar.The panini was simple and tasty. I liked adding the Parmigiano cheese to enhance the flavour.Oh, they also serve nice coffee. I loved my strong black - gave me a wake-up buzz for the whole afternoon. ‚òïÔ∏èOverall, it‚Äôs a great place! Again, loved the ambiance. Hope to visit again while here! üëçüèº
Location: No A-G18, Miri Times Square, Marina Parkcity, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Michelle Mapang
Review: Food is actually good here but the food arrived almost an hour later so naturally, anyone would get upset when the food arrives an hour later regardless of how amazing the place looks like. Author: Antonio Zac
Review: Ordered delivery cause was not keen on going out. Packaging is 100/100, best one I've seen (especially the benedict). ‚Ä¶MoreOrdered delivery cause was not keen on going out. Packaging is 100/100, best one I've seen (especially the benedict).Now for the food:Pork Belly Aglio Oglio - Spaghetti was a little bland for my taste but was nice. Pork belly was the star of the meal. Though you can get far cheaper prices for pork belly of this variant in town. Price was 34.90 on Grab, not worth the price imo. 4/10.The Diablo - Expected a more crispier texture but I guess the wait made them a tad soggy. Taste was ok, am not much of a seafood person. Portion is similar to a personal pan pizza (6-8 inches, probably a bit more), quite generous with the toppings. Liked this one. Costed 34.70. 5/10.Smoked benedict - english muffins were very soggy by the time I wanted to dig in. Hoped they were more toasted. The poached egg had a particularly strong taste. Hollandaise sauce was either non-existent or was too little. Costed 25.70. Piato Bistro's is slightly cheaper and has a broader selection, recommend visit there for your eggs benedict fix. 1/10.For an average Mirian, the place has very extravagant prices with somewhat mediocre food. Heard the drinks, ambience and customer service is excellent, might try in a later future, but not too soon.

Author: Chien Ya Su
Review: 2 stars are for the relaxed and sophisticated ambience and effort behind the decor, as well as the service, especially the girl who served us that night - very attentive and polite. Unfortunately the main aspects that should keep a f&b ‚Ä¶More2 stars are for the relaxed and sophisticated ambience and effort behind the decor, as well as the service, especially the girl who served us that night - very attentive and polite. Unfortunately the main aspects that should keep a f&b establishment going are a bit of a let down - the food and drinks.I had an iced latte - bit on the weak side, price is fair for a coffee of that size (RM10). I savoured the avocado cheesecake (RM17.90?), the Diablo flatbread (RM29.90), and the Cuban panini. With the price tag, I expected a lot more. For the avocado cheesecake, certainly, it was light in its taste - more delicate than the usual cheesecake - instead of cheese or avocado, the mixture somehow gave the distinct impression of gelatin being the dominant taste. I can't be sure if this ingredient was used or not, it's the only word I could use to describe the experience.As for the Diablo, I was warned to not expect the usual pizza or bready texture associated with Greek, Italian or Middle Eastern cousins but rather a thin, biscuit-y and crispy texture which I quite liked. The toppings themselves smelled really good and the flavours went together quite well, until a dining partner commented that there was a pungent "blue cheese" smell. I didn't think that aged cheddar could taste that strong, we figured it was coming from the prawns.Cuban - The server/cashier forewarned to me that the dish would be 'salty', which I was prepared for, otherwise, what good is a pickle in a cubano without the salt? :) What I did not expect was that that was the only taste in the sandwich which was otherwise quite bland. For RM 25.90 and being notified by the server, I expected to get a salty-porky hit from the ham, umami from the cheese, and a sweet-sour pickle to contrast. The texture of the panini itself was good. The redeeming factor for that dish was the fries (dusted with parmesan?) which was not meant to be the star of the dish!I'd give The Nest another go for other usual cakes (something with chocolate), and perhaps savour a breakfast dish or their burger. For the prices attached, my expectations remain high.
Location: No A-G18, Miri Times Square, Marina Parkcity, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Joseph Laing
Review: Breakfast for two.  We were the only customers at 10:30am on a Tuesday.  The Nest‚Äôs food is a western menu; not too popular in Miri at breakfast time, where most everyone wants their Kolok Mee in the morning. ‚Ä¶MoreBreakfast for two.  We were the only customers at 10:30am on a Tuesday.  The Nest‚Äôs food is a western menu; not too popular in Miri at breakfast time, where most everyone wants their Kolok Mee in the morning.We started with coffees, which were strong and fresh; a bit too strong for my partner but I enjoyed my latte.My partner had the breakfast special.  The presentation was enticing, in a big nest of string potatoes, on sourdough bread, with bacon and quail eggs, which were flavorful.  The Sausage was a bit tart (assam) so my partner transferred it to my plate.I had Eggs Benedict. The Eggs Benedict was perfect, very authentic, exactly as shown in the menu.The plates were not delivered at the same time, but I don‚Äôt expect this to happen very often in Asia, unless I‚Äôm at at a 5 star hotel in Singapore.The waiter was good. The food was delivered in 15 minutes.I retuned a week later, on my way back from a long hike in Lambir National Park, hungry and thirsty, I stopped at The Nest mid-afternoon and ordered the Ultimate Burger and two Strawberry Coolers.  It was certainly the BEST BURGER I‚Äôve ever had in Miri.  The beef burger, cooked perfectly medium, was accompanied with a bbq rib patty, red cole-slaw and sweet potatoes fries.   Great service, 15 minutes for the burger.
Location: No A-G18, Miri Times Square, Marina Parkcity, 98000, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Meng Yang Ng
Review: Ample portions here at one of the few proper brunch places in Miri. We had lunch this time around and enjoyed the lamb shoulder, albeit I wasn't a fan of their chicken chop. Service is decent and the restaurant size is pretty cozy.
Location: 2456, Jalan Boulevard 2a/1, Boulevard Commercial Centre, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Philociraptor
Review: The customer service is pleasant. The place is cozy and comfy. The vibes are good. But the main thing about this place. The FOOD! The best Spaghetti I have ever tasted in my life! The texture and the taste is way off the charts! My wife ‚Ä¶MoreThe customer service is pleasant. The place is cozy and comfy. The vibes are good. But the main thing about this place. The FOOD! The best Spaghetti I have ever tasted in my life! The texture and the taste is way off the charts! My wife ordered the main dish which is Salmon Fillet and the way they cook is AMAZING! The crispiness of the Salmon skin and the flesh is tender and juicy! Man! If only I can give 6 stars...
Location: 2456, Jalan Boulevard 2a/1, Boulevard Commercial Centre, Miri, Sarawak

Location: 2456, Jalan Boulevard 2a/1, Boulevard Commercial Centre, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Dean Yeo
Review: Food was decent, has lots of room for improvement. One of the egg benedicts was a bit undercooked as it was too runny, the other was fine. The salmon omelette was a tad too undercooked as well and pieces of bones were present all over ‚Ä¶MoreFood was decent, has lots of room for improvement. One of the egg benedicts was a bit undercooked as it was too runny, the other was fine. The salmon omelette was a tad too undercooked as well and pieces of bones were present all over (preparation of food should undergo thorough scrutiny before serving to customers). Waiter had problem understanding what is a "croissant (kwa-son)" and forgot to add it in the order. During the second order, had to repeat it multiple times in proper pronunciation and still didn't get it, in the end, had to resort to "kra-son". When asked difference between items, the waiter had to ask the owner to explain, whom was actually very kind to explain thoroughly. Otherwise, atmosphere was nice and clean.
Location: 2456, Jalan Boulevard 2a/1, Boulevard Commercial Centre, Miri, Sarawak

Review: Have been here around a year ago. The food taste good, but the place needs a renovation. The food taste good, but the place needs a renovation. The floor was spoiled and the wall corners are dirty, and the door was like broken, I couldn't even open and close it, felt like pushing a 50kg stone rolling door. Doesn't worth the money, they could have given a better environment, I am from kl, to be honest the price here is more expensive comparing to some of the restaurant in KL with similar western food bistro.

Author: Jo-Lynn Liao
Review: Meng Chai has moved to a new location at Tanjung Lobang stalls, we were initially skeptical with the new setup but decided to give it a chance. The grilled fish was fresh and delicious, the same for the steamed clams and the fried chicken ‚Ä¶MoreMeng Chai has moved to a new location at Tanjung Lobang stalls, we were initially skeptical with the new setup but decided to give it a chance. The grilled fish was fresh and delicious, the same for the steamed clams and the fried chicken feet. However, would give the fried lamb a miss next time - it was rather dry and salty.Happy to see Meng Chai open again!
Location: Taman Selera Tanjung Lobang, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Matthew Phang
Review: Nice seafood restaurant that serves affordable seafood dishes. Dishes here cooked by the chefs and cooks are not salty at all. Very pleasant to the taste buds. They offer a wide variety of fresh seafood here. They are busy during peak ‚Ä¶MoreNice seafood restaurant that serves affordable seafood dishes. Dishes here cooked by the chefs and cooks are not salty at all. Very pleasant to the taste buds. They offer a wide variety of fresh seafood here. They are busy during peak periods so it's advisable to be there early. Slight waiting time need for dishes to be served during peak hours. An overall pleasant evening.
Location: Taman Selera Tanjung Lobang, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Betty Yong
Review: This quaint little restaurant serves fresh seafood that‚Äôs perfectly prepared. It‚Äôs not those high end restaurants with 5 star ambience but serving food worth the 5 stars! ‚Ä¶MoreThis quaint little restaurant serves fresh seafood that‚Äôs perfectly prepared. It‚Äôs not those high end restaurants with 5 star ambience but serving food worth the 5 stars!If you are a seafood lover, you will know this is THE place for the fresh catch of the day!Strongly recommend their deep fried sotong, grill sardine and of course the must try local fern that‚Äôs a Sarawak delicacy ‚ÄúMidin‚Äù cooked with red wine.
Location: Taman Selera Tanjung Lobang, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Meng Yang Ng
Review: Personally my favorite, and freshest seafood place in Miri. Gotta know what to order, and would say that their fried calamari or sotong goreng is the best around. Also recommend the mackerel, sardines, garlic pomfret just to name a few.

Author: Matthew Nyambang
Review: 7/10 for the food but that's the only good news. The rest of it is a bit more concerning. The service is average but the waitresses and waiters are very rude and not to mention very inattentive. The prices are quite high and the ambience is ‚Ä¶More7/10 for the food but that's the only good news. The rest of it is a bit more concerning. The service is average but the waitresses and waiters are very rude and not to mention very inattentive. The prices are quite high and the ambience is very loud. It's a shame that the overall service is lousy because I really like the food (especially the grilled golden white pomfret with garlic sauce). If you don't really care about friendly services and prices then I don't see the reason why you shouldn't give Meng Chai a try.
Location: Taman Selera Tanjung Lobang, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Ming Choon Tang
Review: We had a really nice steamed Tom Yam fish, very nice clams steamed with ginger. The fried lamb chop went really well with the beer! The bilin vege cold dish is nice too but not the best around... We will definitely come back again, highly recommended!
Location: Taman Selera Tanjung Lobang, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Eugym Fong
Review: Nice seafood with cheaper price, I having a meal at here for two times. Two times also make me satisfied with the price. Latest, I order 3 small lobsters, a quarter of Tom Yam steamed fish, a fried squid, a vege, two rices, and a teas with the prices less than MYR 160. But the portions can served for 4 peoples.
Location: Taman Selera Tanjung Lobang, Miri, Sarawak

Author: William Wong
Review: There were quite a number of tables inside and outside on the walkway of the restaurant. ‚Ä¶MoreThere were quite a number of tables inside and outside on the walkway of the restaurant.Food we ordered:‚Ä¢	Kangkung Belacan‚Ä¢	Grilled Sardine fish‚Ä¢	Steamed white pomfret‚Ä¢	Local stir fried vegetable‚Ä¢	Grass jelly drinkFood was above average. Both the Sardine and Pomfret fish were fresh but other than this, nothing really stood out from the dishes we ordered.
Location: Taman Selera Tanjung Lobang, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Jee Kah Jin
Review: With so many seafood restaurants opening in recent time, business must have been affected. The annex is now selling someting else. Cooks must have been left off as only tom yang fish is available. However range of seafood is still fairly ‚Ä¶MoreWith so many seafood restaurants opening in recent time, business must have been affected. The annex is now selling someting else. Cooks must have been left off as only tom yang fish is available. However range of seafood is still fairly large. Parking has slways been a problem in this area. Only seafood served, so limiting to families who have children who preferred chix.
Location: Taman Selera Tanjung Lobang, Miri, Sarawak

Author: KIMI CHONG
Review: Good seafood with good staffs service.
Location: Taman Selera Tanjung Lobang, Miri, Sarawak

Author: JR
Review: Overrated definitely. All these talks about it being one of the best Chinese restaurants in Miri turned out to be false. Outdated and old restaurant setup, with funky smell. Food was very normal. If you are used to finely prepared Chinese ‚Ä¶MoreOverrated definitely. All these talks about it being one of the best Chinese restaurants in Miri turned out to be false. Outdated and old restaurant setup, with funky smell. Food was very normal. If you are used to finely prepared Chinese food, you will rate The food here fairly badly. The surroundings of the restaurant were filthy too. Trash and  stagnant pools of water gave out putrid stench, certainly did not help with appetite.
Location: Taman Selera Tanjung Lobang, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Jocelyn Vansen
Review: I suppose the speciality here is really their sambal, other than that I think that it‚Äôs pretty pricey. Had their salted egg crab; didn‚Äôt think it was good at all. Mengchai is good with sambal, given there are other choices in Miri perhaps would unlikely come again
Location: Taman Selera Tanjung Lobang, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Philip Wong

Author: Faisal Abdul Latif
Review: Good food, friendly service. Price not the cheapest, but tasty and good quality. Menu has diverse and expanding range of choices. Service speed depends greatly on crowd volume; during times when less busy, orders arrive very quickly (around ‚Ä¶MoreGood food, friendly service. Price not the cheapest, but tasty and good quality. Author: Yong Kiat Lee
Review: Previously tried excapade in brunei and this time decided to give it a try here. Honestly, it is an expensive sushi place, if u come here expecting a cheap meal u better off go to sushi king or other shops. The staffs are friendly and the ‚Ä¶MorePreviously tried excapade in brunei and this time decided to give it a try here. Honestly, it is an expensive sushi place, if u come here expecting a cheap meal u better off go to sushi king or other shops. The staffs are friendly and the interior of the shop is really nice. Ordered a ramen and sushi set. For me, the only delicious thing in the ramen is the soup. The rest i think cant be normal than normal. Sushi set appears in a good plating. However the sushi is way too dissapointing for the price we are paying. The squid is so rubbery and the tuna is just not fresh at all. Wanted to give it a 1.5 star for the lower tier food but since the ambient is great i guess I can still tolerate with 2 stars.
Location: Block B, Taman Selera Tanjung Lobang, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Chai Jie
Review: They sell good Japanese cuisine. However, during my experience today, I felt that their staffs are very irresponsible. Probably it is a matter of lack of staff too. ‚Ä¶MoreThey sell good Japanese cuisine. However, during my experience today, I felt that their staffs are very irresponsible. Probably it is a matter of lack of staff too.Firstly, we ordered two very simple sushi dishes at the start of our dining but it didn‚Äôt come. Even my friends who came late and placed their order later than me got their dishes already before I got the two. One dish came after I made a request to them and the other did not come at all even after we left the table. Then we were making the payment at the cashier, she actually wanted us to bring the dish (takeaway) home. I refused it, it was unreasonable. Although they gave me some very unwilling faces, but it will be unfair to us if I accepted that offer as it is clearly their fault, I‚Äôm not bearing it for them.Secondly, we were asking for green tea throughout our meal but it just didn‚Äôt come after six attempts. We only started having it half way through our meal and it made the experience quite unpleasant.Thirdly, a less severe one is that no one came to clear the plates. They shouldn‚Äôt have charge us that much service charge because I walked to the waiters to give them out order and cleared our own plates and put them in their respective baskets/trays.In conclusion, I would not come here again if their services remain the same. If anyone really wants to eat sushi in Miri, try out the newly opened Sushi Zanmai.
Location: Block B, Taman Selera Tanjung Lobang, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Scorpio Sagi-Aqua
Review: Food served was above average.Service was below average.Waiters and waitress were busy chatting and we could even hear their voices. The cashier caught our attention by singing at the counter.
Location: Lot 683, Block 9, Jalan Pujut-Lutong, CDT No.20, Lot 683, Miri, Sarawak

Author: jason lee
Review: When it's full house prepare to wait. One of the better typical Chinese food  in Miri. Peking duck , roast pig and some other dishes  need to prebook.
Location: Lot 683, Block 9, Jalan Pujut-Lutong, CDT No.20, Lot 683, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Percival Lee
Review: Considered by some to be the preferred sit in Chinese style dining restaurant in Miri, the restaurant features a beautiful interior.  The staff are friendly and there‚Äôs vegetarian options available here.  I had some fried bean curd here and ‚Ä¶MoreConsidered by some to be the preferred sit in Chinese style dining restaurant in Miri, the restaurant features a beautiful interior.  The staff are friendly and there‚Äôs vegetarian options available here.  I had some fried bean curd here and it was amazing.I will point out that parking around this restaurant is incredibly tight even for veteran drivers.  If you are uncomfortable even in the slightest about your close quarters driving you should probably take a Grab car or cab or friend‚Äôs car instead.
Location: Lot 683, Block 9, Jalan Pujut-Lutong, CDT No.20, Lot 683, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Win Tai
Review: Very posh Chinese restaurant. Good food must book in Advance. We walked in at 6pm they still had table for 3. Loved the service and food quality. Bit expensive for local standards but well worth it. Must try if you in Miri looking for Chinese food. Vegetarian options available. Free Fruits served.
Location: Lot 683, Block 9, Jalan Pujut-Lutong, CDT No.20, Lot 683, Miri, Sarawak

Author: JOY KITTEN
Review: Second time at this resto and I was looking forward as the first time was awesome. ‚Ä¶MoreSecond time at this resto and I was looking forward as the first time was awesome.Not disappointed. I missed out on a few pics as I had to step away halfway.Do come! Food is so awesome!!
Location: Lot 683, Block 9, Jalan Pujut-Lutong, CDT No.20, Lot 683, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Molly Cher
Review: Excellent food and service. Servers were very attentive. Food was really tasty but on the pricy side. Good place to meet up for couples, groups or families.
Location: Lot 683, Block 9, Jalan Pujut-Lutong, CDT No.20, Lot 683, Miri, Sarawak

Author: che hui xin
Review: Cozy environment with attentive service, delicious food, worth the price, free dessert; but the aircon was abit too cold üòÇ
Location: Lot 683, Block 9, Jalan Pujut-Lutong, CDT No.20, Lot 683, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Paul Wong
Review: If you have time to kill then this is definitely the place. Do allocate waiting time of 45 to 60mins for your first dish. Think twice before you bring the elderly. ‚Ä¶MoreIf you have time to kill then this is definitely the place. Do allocate waiting time of 45 to 60mins for your first dish. Think twice before you bring the elderly.15/2/22: business is now too good until they can reject take away order.
Location: Lot 683, Block 9, Jalan Pujut-Lutong, CDT No.20, Lot 683, Miri, Sarawak

Author: kalabatu salunda
Review: One of the best Chinese restaurant in Miri. Make reservation or come early to avoid disappointment.
Location: Lot 683, Block 9, Jalan Pujut-Lutong, CDT No.20, Lot 683, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Lj
Review: 5 stars if VIP ROOM can karaoke.
Location: Lot 683, Block 9, Jalan Pujut-Lutong, CDT No.20, Lot 683, Miri, Sarawak

Author: kong 2233
Review: Good restaurant . I give 5 star
Location: Lot 683, Block 9, Jalan Pujut-Lutong, CDT No.20, Lot 683, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Sai Kit Yong
Review: Came here for dinner 2 nights in a row because it was excellent. If you're here you have to order the pecking duck, honey pork ribs, and steam cod fish. These dishes are superb. Go earlier, preferably before 7 pm for dinner,  else it'll be full and wait time will be long. Service was great and extremely reasonably priced.
Location: Lot 683, Block 9, Jalan Pujut-Lutong, CDT No.20, Lot 683, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Nicholas Soon
Review: During my last visit, I noticed that the service wasn't that good. We placed order for 7 dishes and the 7th dish came very late. I told the waitress to 'dapao' (wrapped for take away) and to my surprise the roasted chicken has missing section when we opened at home. Other than that the surrounding was pleasant.
Location: Lot 683, Block 9, Jalan Pujut-Lutong, CDT No.20, Lot 683, Miri, Sarawak

Author: stephanie ting
Review: quality and standard used to be very good. Peking duck somehow disappointing on my last visit as was verging on dry side. Despite the occasional disappointments, most of the dishes were good and I love their beancurd dish very much! spare ‚Ä¶Morequality and standard used to be very good. Peking duck somehow disappointing on my last visit as was verging on dry side. Despite the occasional disappointments, most of the dishes were good and I love their beancurd dish very much! spare ribs was also very good!service is generally good except one visit where the waitress kept forgetting to refill our tea and we had to remind her several times. apart from that, service is pretty fast.would definitely return for more beancurd!
Location: Lot 683, Block 9, Jalan Pujut-Lutong, CDT No.20, Lot 683, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Trina Tan Xin Yi
Review: It was fantastic. The service was great and the food is very delicious. I enjoy eating there .I can see alot effort  being made. You guys will have 5 stars from  me. Thank you very much . You guys made my day.
Location: Lot 683, Block 9, Jalan Pujut-Lutong, CDT No.20, Lot 683, Miri, Sarawak

Author: kyokoryu suou
Review: The ribs were really good. The peking duck was OK. Everything else is average and is what you'd normally get at a Chinese restaurant. MUST order the ribs. Call the place in advance and order or you would have to wait for a long time.

Author: Danny
Review: Do not expect seafood and, fish and chips here even if it's named surf and turf. The chicken portion here is large. Generous portion with good price(apparently lots of 5 stars review given because of just that). However there is no greens. ‚Ä¶MoreDo not expect seafood and, fish and chips here even if it's named surf and turf. The chicken portion here is large. Generous portion with good price(apparently lots of 5 stars review given because of just that). However there is no greens. Main dish is served on top of mashed potato, contaminating the taste. Ordered the bbq Guinness chicken but didn't get the malt taste on it. The poached egg is more to hard boiled egg. Mashed potato still have large chunk of potato in it. They try to mix it with some seafood but i got a prawn shell in it. However the waitress is polite but doesn't seem to introduce their speciality.
Location: Lot 10158, Jalan Pujut 7, Off, Jalan Pujut, Lutong, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Tony Jeanes
Review: Entrance is a bit shabby and you do wonder if you made a good choice, as it's the only Indian restaurant in town my desire for a curry took me up. The place itself is really nice, aside from the screaming child, but that was a family dining ‚Ä¶MoreEntrance is a bit shabby and you do wonder if you made a good choice, as it's the only Indian restaurant in town my desire for a curry took me up. The place itself is really nice, aside from the screaming child, but that was a family dining there and would be hard to deal with. The menu isn't extensive but a good enough selection is available. I opted for lamb Rogan Josh with tarka Dahl and garlic naan with a fresh mango lassi. The option to spice it up was taken. The meal was delicious, the meat was very tender, cooked on the bone and the Dahl was perfect as were the garlic naan, I ordered another they were that good. Service too was excellent. The bill was 77mr but worth every ringgit.
Location: Lot 2512, Jalan Miri-Pujut, Boulevard Commercial Centre, Sarawak, Miri

Author: Abeng Ach MT

Location: Lot 2512, Jalan Miri-Pujut, Boulevard Commercial Centre, Sarawak, Miri

Fries where cold and soggy, salad had no dressing, the prawns ‚Ä¶MoreWe‚Äôve been staying in Pullman Waterfront several times and it seems that the quality of food is getting lower and lower. Breakfast buffet looks unattended and the hot food is mostly dried out. In the Executive Lounge where the food supposed to be prepared fresh it arrives cold and takes a long time to arrive. Service is not much around

Author: ChauChingchau Cucut
Review: It was tasty for me but definitely not the best Sarawak Laksa I ever tasted. You might like it if you like creamier taste of coconut milk. Unfortunately during my visit, the broth was warm as in room temperature despite the fact that it was ‚Ä¶MoreIt was tasty for me but definitely not the best Sarawak Laksa I ever tasted. You might like it if you like creamier taste of coconut milk. Unfortunately during my visit, the broth was warm as in room temperature despite the fact that it was served using hot pot. It was quite pricey too compared to other eateries that serves Laksa of the same portion but tastier in taste. Parking was limited and you have to park alongside the roadside to avoid getting blocked by other car if you were to park inside the house compound as it is a home based -eatery.
Location: 349, Jalan Miri - Lutong, Lutong, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Potongrumput Miri.
Review: My preferred White Laksa in town.No regret though rather pricey considering the generous Big Bowl serving.Can't give 5star rating for the Home Based Open seating but love to eat out and enjoy the better laksa.

Author: D. Arifin
Review: Excellent place to endulge in authentic, locally made Laksa Sarawak.It's priced around RM 8 or $2.50, absolutely affordable and mouth-watering. ‚Ä¶MoreExcellent place to endulge in authentic, locally made Laksa Sarawak.It's priced around RM 8 or $2.50, absolutely affordable and mouth-watering.Foreigners and tourists are highly encouraged to try Laksa Sarawak here at Laksa Lolita, Miri.
Location: 349, Jalan Miri - Lutong, Lutong, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Samuel Wong
Review: Best Laksa in town. Nestled away from the hustle and bustle of Miri town centre is a quiet little cafe with the aroma of the Laksa broth lingering in the air. An excellent place to indulge in a bowl of Laksa or two in peace and quiet
Location: 349, Jalan Miri - Lutong, Lutong, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Ifan Ramadhana
Review: It takes some time to look for this place, but really this small shop next to the house offers the best Laksa I ever taste, like their name suggest they might be rightful place to held the title of "The best Laksa in Sarawak". ‚Ä¶MoreIt takes some time to look for this place, but really this small shop next to the house offers the best Laksa I ever taste, like their name suggest they might be rightful place to held the title of "The best Laksa in Sarawak".Laksa Lolita located in the house in Lutong, there is a large field outside the house for parking and inside there is simple plastic chair and wooden table, but don't let it deceived you, when you order a bowl of Laksa, you will understand why. The broth is so savoury with soft noodle topped with piece of chicken and shrimp.I genuinely think that everyone that visit Miri should visit the place, it's an unforgettable experience for your tastebud. You won't regret it.
Location: 349, Jalan Miri - Lutong, Lutong, Miri, Sarawak
