Author: Jiaren Lau
Review: Dear owner,Thank you for taking the time to respond to my 1-star rating only review. It was ‚Ä¶MoreDear owner,Thank you for taking the time to respond to my 1-star rating only review. It was not actually your establishment that I wanted to review, rather the branch operating out of Pujut 9. Those were the most disgusting burgers I've had in my life.That was 6 months ago.Coincidentally, I visited this branch last week (for the first time). While everything was certainly better than my initial 1-star rating, it lacks a few things that make it a 5-star experience, namely the metal poll left outside the main entrance that represents a major safety hazard, and the average tasting burgers. The fries are mostly the end bits that look like they were from the bottom of the pack.I would still say it was a decent experience as there's a good vibe, nice and clean layout, large tables, and the presentation of the food is decent. Price is good  and I'd be keen to come back to try the rice dishes and what looks to be pretty good coffee, but definitely not the burgers. Admittedly, I have yet to find a really good burger in Miri.Sorry again for the initial low rating which I have now updated to reflect this branch. However, still a lot of room for improvement in my opinion.
Location: Jalan astana phase 6, Bandar Baru Permyjaya, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Wong Chong Yang
Review: I went there for takeaway, I didn't know where to wait for my foods after ordered. I saw the drink I ordered was put on the counter table, but they didn't give it to me. OK, it might not be mine. After a few minutes, I asked the cashier ‚Ä¶MoreI went there for takeaway, I didn't know where to wait for my foods after ordered. I saw the drink I ordered was put on the counter table, but they didn't give it to me. OK, it might not be mine. After a few minutes, I asked the cashier about my order. OK, the drink was mine, but the burger wasn't ready. After about 40 minutes I had finished my drink while waiting, I asked the busy server about my burger, it had already been done 15 minutes ago cuz I literally saw the particular burger was put on the table when I was drinking but I didn't know it was mine. When I got the burger it was no longer hot, the buns are soggy and the cheese sauce was all over the wrap. Gotta ask the cashier what's the 'procedure' of eating at Don's burger. The cashier was nice even she was extremely busy, she could speak mandarin too.
Location: Jalan astana phase 6, Bandar Baru Permyjaya, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Alimin Juna
Review: Easily the best joint if you're munching hard. Soul food has never been best represented in Miri until now. Though it's more towards white people soul food, that's been carefully and meticulously adjusted to the Sarawak pallette. ‚Ä¶MoreEasily the best joint if you're munching hard. Soul food has never been best represented in Miri until now. Though it's more towards white people soul food, that's been carefully and meticulously adjusted to the Sarawak pallette.For absolute beginners, you should definitely go for the Krispy Monyeng. But if you're hungry, go 240 Krispy, which means double patty.Still hungry? They now have rice dishes, and for those who wants to stay longer in the toilet, they have chicken skins, slathered in some sort of orange concoction which I don't dare to question.Don's burgers are simple. You order, you eat. And you'll unconditionally love whatever you order and plus extra.Reasonably priced, and hassle free.
Location: Jalan astana phase 6, Bandar Baru Permyjaya, Miri, Sarawak

Author: LxD
Review: This new emerging cafe located in the hornbill nature reserve offers local dishes & drinks at affordable prices. The Bee Hoon Siam in particular is especially delicious and highly recommended. ‚Ä¶MoreThis new emerging cafe located in the hornbill nature reserve offers local dishes & drinks at affordable prices. The Bee Hoon Siam in particular is especially delicious and highly recommended.The relaxing and comfortable environment provides a laidback setting for respite, social gatherings or business meeting spot. If your lucky, the local hornbills may occasionally grace the cafe with their presence & can be seen perching themselves just outside the cafe grounds where they can be viewed through the large glass windows.
Location: Nature Reserve, Lot 1274, Jalan Peninsula, Piasau, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Sophia Osman
Review: Beautiful view. Clean beach compared to other area in Miri. Food is good. Recommended for party or gathering.
Location: Secretary P.B.C., Sarawak Shell Berhad, Locked Bag No. 1, Miri, Sarawak

Author: ikonic younina
Review: The beach is gorgeous.The playground is rather large and spacious, very good fun. It's boat themed. ‚Ä¶MoreThe beach is gorgeous.The playground is rather large and spacious, very good fun. It's boat themed.Sitting spaces are decent ( all wood ) .The restaurant .Service is slow and the servers aren't exactly well trained. A little unsanitary. Personally feel they are not up-to-date with serving techniques during this time of easy infection.Food itself is decent. If you want your drinks within half an hour you have to stand /wait at the bar . They'll make your drinks quicker then. If not, your beer will be ready instantly but be left on the counter to be warm before the server sends it to you.Facilities.Washroom / changing room is small and inadequate. Not well ventilated. I wouldn't say it's dirty, but it isn't clean either. There are only two shower rooms and three toilet stalls.
Location: Secretary P.B.C., Sarawak Shell Berhad, Locked Bag No. 1, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Joseph Laing
Review: I love the Boat Club.  I‚Äôve been a member for 20 years. But the restaurant food is horrible.  Last night we ordered Caesar salads and cashew chicken via Panda.  The chicken was old and hard, like rubber. The sauce, weak and watered down.  The hard rubbery cashew chicken was too hot /spicy to eat.
Location: Secretary P.B.C., Sarawak Shell Berhad, Locked Bag No. 1, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Lee Chin
Review: Nice place to chill. Lots of trees to shade the sitting area as we were there around 11am-12pm on a Sunday. Kitchen only opens from 11am onwards when we were there. There is a RM10 entry fee for non members and it can be used again even if ‚Ä¶MoreNice place to chill. Lots of trees to shade the sitting area as we were there around 11am-12pm on a Sunday. Kitchen only opens from 11am onwards when we were there. There is a RM10 entry fee for non members and it can be used again even if you've exited, as long as within the same day. So we came back to catch the sunset! Lottsss of people in the evening!
Location: Secretary P.B.C., Sarawak Shell Berhad, Locked Bag No. 1, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Michelle Nellissa
Review: A very nice place to chill. Just by the beach. Good for kids and family gatherings. Always packed/full. Now, they charged RM10 per person per entry, and coupon cannot be used to buy food and drinks. Not like before only RM10/car entry + ‚Ä¶MoreA very nice place to chill. Just by the beach. Good for kids and family gatherings. Always packed/full. Now, they charged RM10 per person per entry, and coupon cannot be used to buy food and drinks. Not like before only RM10/car entry + coupon can use to claim/buy food. Good, clean & beautiful ‚ù§Ô∏è place. Totally recommended to visit here!!! Today 10/10/2021. Adult RM10/person. Children age 12-17 RM5/person. Below 12yo FREE.
Location: Secretary P.B.C., Sarawak Shell Berhad, Locked Bag No. 1, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Tasha Telun La'ing
Review: Didn't come here often. The playgrounds need some serious maintenance. Same goes to the sofa rotan my daughter and i sat on. Badly damaged exposing the steel inside, which could be dangerous. However, i love this place, its a nice decent place to visit, with the calm environment. Clean beach btw üíï
Location: Secretary P.B.C., Sarawak Shell Berhad, Locked Bag No. 1, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Johnson Wong
Review: Actually it's a good place for weekend. I don't have any chance to eat at the restaurant because my dog is with me. If I bring my dog to the restaurant. I guess, my dog would scared away the customers and yet many people are scared of dogs. ‚Ä¶MoreActually it's a good place for weekend. I don't have any chance to eat at the restaurant because my dog is with me. If I bring my dog to the restaurant. I guess, my dog would scared away the customers and yet many people are scared of dogs. There's is sign of no dogs and cycling is prohibited. According to my friends, the sign board is at the playground, so the beach is OK.
Location: Secretary P.B.C., Sarawak Shell Berhad, Locked Bag No. 1, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Miss Unknown
Review: I went here dine in here several times, I hope they can improve their food quality, and this place need some serious maintenance which is restaurant, playground, gym & other sport facilities. It‚Äôs a great place to hangout it just that they really need to start renovate the place.

Location: Secretary P.B.C., Sarawak Shell Berhad, Locked Bag No. 1, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Meng Yang Ng
Review: Great for families and view of the sunset. Need to be a member to eat and use the facilities, but prices aren't ridiculous. Good gym, tennis, basketball, squash courts and sailing facilities. Plus, I really love the kampung fried rice here!
Location: Secretary P.B.C., Sarawak Shell Berhad, Locked Bag No. 1, Miri, Sarawak

Author: jeremy peet
Review: The boat club is probably one of my favourite spots in Miri. The club is open air so you'll get a full view of the beach and sunset from any table and a fresh sea breeze. Bring a kite as there's always a good wind. They have range of ‚Ä¶MoreThe boat club is probably one of my favourite spots in Miri. The club is open air so you'll get a full view of the beach and sunset from any table and a fresh sea breeze. Bring a kite as there's always a good wind. They have range of activities with toddler and older kids play areas which are in view of the restaurant (bar end), making it ideal for families (note the current Covid-19 SOP's may temporarily prohibit kids entering).The menu is OK. Not exceptional but decent portions with a good range of local and western dishes all reasonably priced. I'd recommend the umai (local raw fish dish) for anyone a little daring. They have draft beer and cider to wash down the chef favorites of burgers, fish and chips or char kway teow. Get there before 6pm to catch the sun setting of the rim of your favour pint.
Location: Secretary P.B.C., Sarawak Shell Berhad, Locked Bag No. 1, Miri, Sarawak

Membership grants access to the gym, boating facilities and various courts. Non-members can patronize the restaurant and one of the nicer beach views in Miri. The fact that the boat club is located next to the Piasau nature reserve and is frequented by the (quite people-friendly) hornbills that live in the reserve is a really nice bonus.

There were not many customers there that time.  I had a "sea food sambal" with white rice. Was not very good,  the crab and prawns were not fresh. So, hope the management do something bout it. There's no please, and thank u. Baby seat ambil sendiri, self service katanya. Im okay with that. Hope for a better experience next time..

Author: Jonny Tie
Review: Very special serving style. They pour the seafood that you order on the table. Don't worry, the put a layer of high quality plastic on the table. The sambal paste they use is delicious, take note that if you can't eat spicy food then don't ‚Ä¶MoreVery special serving style. They pour the seafood that you order on the table. Don't worry, the put a layer of high quality plastic on the table. The sambal paste they use is delicious, take note that if you can't eat spicy food then don't try the medium or extra spicy. You're going to regret it. Lastly keep in mind that they used weight to serve their seafood, so if you can't eat a lot then ask a few friends to join you. Overall a must visit in miri town.

On the chalk board it was clearly listed that mojhitos were part of the deal however when it came to pay I was told that the board wasn't up to date (only wine and beer was included now) and that its not part of ladies night. With quite a lot of explaining and defiance they deducted the mojhito off the bill and I advised they update the board to make sure the mistake doesn't happen again.

Author: Siew Ling L
Review: Came here for the first time wanting to try the hokkaido custard taiyaki, end up being disappointed in almost every way.  First, the look, it doesn‚Äôt look like a proper fish at all, seems like a distorted kind. The pictures shown on the ‚Ä¶MoreCame here for the first time wanting to try the hokkaido custard taiyaki, end up being disappointed in almost every way.  First, the look, it doesn‚Äôt look like a proper fish at all, seems like a distorted kind. The pictures shown on the menu were way more pretty that what was actually served on the table. Second, the taste, too oily, custards just don‚Äôt taste like custard.I will probably won‚Äôt visit this shop for the second time anymore.
Location: Lot 2491, Ground Floor, Jalan Boulevard 2b, Boulevard Commercial Centre Miri, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Daniel Tang
Review: Another downfall of my favourite place. The almond jelly had at the start, priced at RM3.50 but went on a gradual hike to RM4.60. Coming along is a disproportionate shrink of portion with the portion hardly filled to half the bowl. The ‚Ä¶MoreAnother downfall of my favourite place. The almond jelly had at the start, priced at RM3.50 but went on a gradual hike to RM4.60. Coming along is a disproportionate shrink of portion with the portion hardly filled to half the bowl. The shaved ice used to mount! Not only this, other items on the menu have also seen price spiralling upwards.
Location: Lot 2491, Ground Floor, Jalan Boulevard 2b, Boulevard Commercial Centre Miri, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Charis Hii
Review: Usually a large menu is a red flag, but they manage to execute each item surprisingly well. Reliable Chinese desserts, durian pancakes, rojak, and even their more nouveau snack offerings are quite delicious. ‚Ä¶MoreUsually a large menu is a red flag, but they manage to execute each item surprisingly well. Reliable Chinese desserts, durian pancakes, rojak, and even their more nouveau snack offerings are quite delicious.They also have special offers occasionally - we got a free matcha au lait with the red bean baked milk and both were yummy.
Location: Lot 2491, Ground Floor, Jalan Boulevard 2b, Boulevard Commercial Centre Miri, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Glen Lendle (GlenXD)
Review: They're famous for Mango and Durian Pancake, Teriyaki which come with variety of flavors to choose from and more. Good customer services (Important matter), facility complete with AC and good place to hangout. Menu, really in Dessert ‚Ä¶MoreThey're famous for Mango and Durian Pancake, Teriyaki which come with variety of flavors to choose from and more. Good customer services (Important matter), facility complete with AC and good place to hangout. Menu, really in Dessert category but they do not serve any cake slice( if you're wondering). Any corrections pls do inform XD.
Location: Lot 2491, Ground Floor, Jalan Boulevard 2b, Boulevard Commercial Centre Miri, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Thomas Jefferson
Review: This place serves a good selection of hot and cold desserts. Unfortunately, their ice machine is currently broken (verified as of 4 May 2018) and they're not able to prepare their signature desserts like mango sago pomelo shaved ice and chendol.
Location: Lot 2491, Ground Floor, Jalan Boulevard 2b, Boulevard Commercial Centre Miri, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Tze Horng Tan
Review: Cozy and comfortable environment for meeting friends or a quick bite.

Author: Vienen Dinero
Review: Newly renovated environment, nice. But service totally went the other way, slow on services, insufficient of food materials, lack of coordination between kitchen and front crew. And it's really sad the play area had been removed. Advice the management to look into these matters seriously.
Location: Lot 2491, Ground Floor, Jalan Boulevard 2b, Boulevard Commercial Centre Miri, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Nacy Chan
Review: Im a visitor to Miri. My first time here and had a real bad experience with the service. The waitress came four times to tell us on the unavailability of the desserts (four separate desserts) that we ordered. Waited for 45mins and only two ‚Ä¶MoreIm a visitor to Miri. My first time here and had a real bad experience with the service. The waitress came four times to tell us on the unavailability of the desserts (four separate desserts) that we ordered. Waited for 45mins and only two desserts served out of six. Disappointed. You should have checked and let us know on what is not available at an earlier time (says 15min), instead of 40min?
Location: Lot 2491, Ground Floor, Jalan Boulevard 2b, Boulevard Commercial Centre Miri, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Jee
Review: The seating is sparse and easy to navigate around tables. Staff is attentive and looks professional in black and are in wireless link with each other. This cuts down staff movements among tables. However, the lighting is a bit bright and ‚Ä¶MoreThe seating is sparse and easy to navigate around tables. Staff is attentive and looks professional in black and are in wireless link with each other. This cuts down staff movements among tables. However, the lighting is a bit bright and this eliminates the cosy and  romantic setting. Shashimi is okay as not as fresh or as generous for the price paid. Rice portion for sushi is too large. Pickled ginger is noticeably missing, even from the menu. The hot sake is good and it went well with the food. Will not go back unless really desperate.

Author: Trond Vendshol

The ika was slightly slimy and more slippery than I would have preferred. ‚Ä¶MoreSome of the sashimi was not too fresh, for example the tuna was dark, almost black and had been cut quite some earlier, as had the salmon, which was matt, not shiny. The ika was slightly slimy and more slippery than I would have preferred. The tuna belly was actually inedible. The Junmai was the only choice of sake. No Japanese beer available.On the plus side, the staff was friendly and attentive. I only tried sashimi/sushi, the place might be ok for other dishes.

Author: Keitano Aeon
Review: Favourite beef noodles among the locals, perhaps due to the only one in town. Portion wise, it was ok. Taste wise decent. Also ordered laksa but gravy was light, some may not like it. Porridge was good. Nancy was friendly as usual, never ‚Ä¶MoreFavourite beef noodles among the locals, perhaps due to the only one in town. Portion wise, it was ok. Taste wise decent. Also ordered laksa but gravy was light, some may not like it. Porridge was good. Nancy was friendly as usual, never shy away for a camera shot. She runs the place but she also get herself busy in the kitchen. Amazing woman.
Location: Jalan Tritona, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Gurjit Samra
Review: If you like Beef Noodles, you'll know this shop. Been here for ages. I do enjoy the beef noodles there. Light, fragrant and delicious. This time I tried their fish porridge for the first time. The fish strips are nice and meaty. They added ‚Ä¶MoreIf you like Beef Noodles, you'll know this shop. Been here for ages. I do enjoy the beef noodles there. Light, fragrant and delicious. This time I tried their fish porridge for the first time. The fish strips are nice and meaty. They added salted fish, salted vegetables and some leafy greens too. Well worth the price if you ask me. Would recommend it to the ones who enjoy porridge in the morning.
Location: Jalan Tritona, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Jee
Review: A small cafe hidden in a maze of one way side streets. Good choice of fresh juices. Famous for their beef noodles. The "special" comes with a bowl of tasty noodles with a sprinkle of minced fried beef. The mix of beef slices, inards, ‚Ä¶MoreA small cafe hidden in a maze of one way side streets. Good choice of fresh juices. Famous for their beef noodles. The "special" comes with a bowl of tasty noodles with a sprinkle of minced fried beef. The mix of beef slices, inards, towgays and a sprinkle of corriander comes in a small quali of soup sitting on a small flame. Chilli and sauces are self-service. The chilli sauce for the beef is hot, similar to KK style. Sliced beef is tender and tasty. Car parking should not be a major set back. However the dish is a bit over-priced but it is a nice change from the normal. No pork is served and so we do see a good patronage from our muslim friends.
Location: Jalan Tritona, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Ching Siang FU
Review: Very good coffee, probably best that I‚Äôve tasted in Miri.Will come be back for their sourdough with anything, good to see food made with ‚Ä¶MoreVery good coffee, probably best that I‚Äôve tasted in Miri.Will come be back for their sourdough with anything, good to see food made with love.Place is also decorated for comfortable vibe to spend some time with friends or to work, like the window corner.

Author: Fairuzaimi Zakaria
Review: Most mediocre grilled cheese sandwich I ever had, and an easily-forgettable cinnamon roll. ‚Ä¶MoreMost mediocre grilled cheese sandwich I ever had, and an easily-forgettable cinnamon roll.Price: Acceptable.Cleanliness: Very good.I ordered one of their set menu which comes with: grilled cheese sandwich, blue pea lemonade, and custard tart (which as I'm typing this, I just realised they've forgotten about the custard tart). The set cost RM20, and I got an extra cinnamon roll on the side for an additional rm5.The grilled cheese sandwich came looking like it had refused getting grilled and the cook just doesn't have the heart to force the sandwich to do what it doesn't want to. The cheese used was mozzarella, with no other ingredient in the sandwich itself. It's like.. the most angelic grilled cheese sandwich (nobody want their grilled cheese to be angelic, we all want them bad).I'm not sure if they had forgotten to reheat the cinnamon roll, or have reheated it and forgot to send them before it gets cold again, but I am very sure that they had forgotten the icing. But alas when I asked the waiter if they had forgotten the icing, I was informed that the icing comes with extra cost of RM3 - which I agreed to pay, only to be later on informed that the icing that they had in stock has gone bad.Update on the custard tart: it came reheated, and taste decent. Thank God for an honorable closing to my meal here.But I'm not returning.
Location: D-G-13A Miri Times Square, Marina ParkCity, Miri

Author: Shirley Chong
Review: First visit. Great coffee! Match latte was amazing too! Love the atmosphere and design of the cafe. A truly local fusion menu, curious to try others though this serving is a bit small for me
Location: D-G-13A Miri Times Square, Marina ParkCity, Miri

Author: Albert JSL
Review: New cafe located at new place - Miri time square. Environment definitely no need to describe much as it is new. Let's go to the food - cappuccino (6/10) and mushroom cheese pie (8/10), price are moderate and acceptable.

Author: meemoo koo
Review: Great place for coffee and pies & pastries. The cafe is cozy and a nice to hang out with friends or by yourself. Try out different kinds of coffee and baked goods e.g tuak pork pie, egg tart, cinnamon buns. Just be aware that this place doesn't serve halal food

Very nice selection of bread, rolls, pastries and coffes. They also serve great breakfast plates! I had amazing cappuccino, super moist banana bread and a fantastic cinnamon roll. Author: G t
Review: U guys crossed a LINE. Some time ago I ordered an egg tart n it's sour, watery with chunks inside. Asked about it n was told the boss decided to carry on using the already smelly ingredient for egg tart fillings apparently to cut cost even ‚Ä¶MoreU guys crossed a LINE. Some time ago I ordered an egg tart n it's sour, watery with chunks inside. Asked about it n was told the boss decided to carry on using the already smelly ingredient for egg tart fillings apparently to cut cost even tho employees already advised her to throw away n make new one. Went home afterwards n had a severe stomachache. Caocibai. To the owner, you lost yourself a loyal customer who's been there since day 1, quality fluctuated over the time n I'm a very understanding person so I didn't mind but u crossed a line here. Keep up the kiamsiap attitude n keep losing your loyal customers along the way. Haven't come back once ever since. Make all the excuses u want, but these words came from your own employees.Update:Not even an apology for the severe stomachache caused n even claimed I complained at the wrong shop. Had to attach a photo to prove its indeed ur shop n indeed Portuguese egg tart was a product of urs? Phew, full marks for the attitude n avoidance :)
Location: D-G-13A Miri Times Square, Marina ParkCity, Miri

Author: Jy Ong

We also ordered a croissant sandwich (which I believe won‚Äôt take so long to prepare) but also, they ‚Ä¶MoreHaving waited for about 40min but sadly when We queried, we were informed that they didn‚Äôt even started to prepare our breakfast yet. We also ordered a croissant sandwich (which I believe won‚Äôt take so long to prepare) but also, they haven‚Äôt started to prepare it yet after 40min has passed. The reason being that there was another ‚Äúbig‚Äù reservation going on so they didn‚Äôt have time to prepare our breakfast. We were never being informed of that when we made our orders. We are so disappointed and we canceled our order. It is really a bad experience having being waited so long but have to walk out without having eaten our breakfast.

I really don't like to get served by her.Response to owner : I have tried the Callebaut chocolate & tiramisu & lemon poppy seed. Wait a minute, quite some time ago I've also tried the cempedak cheese cake. To be fair, the cempedak cheese cake is GOOD. Author: The Choobs
Review: Being commercially recommended by many, somehow not every local will agree that this is the best laksa in Miri. In my opinion however, it's pretty good. The price point on the other hand is really pricey. RM9 for a special seems expensive especially for a town like Miri where everything is affordable.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Jen Chong Wong
Review: Good Kampua Mee and Sarawak Laksa, though the Laksa may be very thick and creamy but it is milder compared to Kuchings Laksa. Claypot Loh Shu Fun was just below average.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Anonymous
Review: A place to get one of the best Mee Perut Sapi in town üëçüèª
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Going Keep
Review: Good Sarawak style laksa. 7RM for laksa. 3RM for coffee. Laksa with around 4 quite big shrimp. Valued for the money. If come to Miri, will visit again. Very satisfied first meal in Miri. Recommend to come.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Abeng Ach MT
Review: One of the best laksa in town. The gravy was thick and flavourful served in a hugh bowl. Fresh prawn and fish balls with coriander leaf compliment the taste.  Squeeze some lime for added sourness.  Perfecto üëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèº
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Michell C
Review: The Sarawak laksa here is really good! It is so flavourful! The soup is very good and I would rate it better than the Sarawak laksa soup not far from this kopitiam.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Lancy Wee
Review: Probably the best Sarawak laksa in Miri. The taste of broth not so heavy herbs taste like the one I had in Kuching but overall still the superb one. Special laksa comes with more prawns and fish balls. Yummy!
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Rob & Steph
Review: Ok laksa but nothing special.  Kolo Mee was ok as well, comparable to "dry style maggie mee" type noodles.  Kopi ais was also on the weak side for my taste.  Was today just an off day?
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Tze Horng Tan
Review: Located near a hotel this cafe is a famous spot for tourists and locals. The black coffee is a must try. The staff is friendly, patient and helpful. There are plenty local food to choose from.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Xuan Jin Toh
Review: Love the Laksa! Simple and delicious. Local food with great pleasures!
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Noel Fredilino
Review: Delicious bowl of sarawak laksa. The kolok mee was decently good as well. If not the best I had.Drinks not too good and expensive... Thus no 5 star rating
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Kumal Govindasamy
Review: Famous for their Sarawak LAKSA. For me it's a mild version of Semenanju Curry Mee. There's nothing about LAKSA in it, flavor or garnish.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Chai Nyuk Chang
Review: Kuching Laksa...best in town
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: CL Liaw
Review: The Laksa aroma is good and tasty, and not so spicy too. Should give a try if you are in Miri.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Sabah Kendo
Review: Really Sarawak taste & price. Come and try for yourselve.  Rm3.50 for kolo mee, rm8 for laksa.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Jacky Chai
Review: Personally this is one of the best laksa in town...every mirian knows where to go when u had craving for laksa...their broth was super flavorful..if you are goin on sunday or holiday..u might need to wait for table..but worth it!!
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Ryan Lee
Review: Great place to have your breakfast or lunch. Nice food, especially laksa and kolo noodles. ‚Ä¶MoreGreat place to have your breakfast or lunch. Nice food, especially laksa and kolo noodles.Staff are polite, arrange seats for us when it full-house.Laksa are slightly expensive compare with others, about RM7 while kolo noodles only RM3.50.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Crispin Hung
Review: One of the best Laksa in Miri. Mini, Normal and Special size available.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Tony Teo
Review: Taste normal laksa....but noting special...
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: J2
Review: Laksa is on the mild side, with more santan than I am used toI prefer my laksa spices to be on the heavy side.Service was fast and efficient.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Kenny Kenol (Thomas)
Review: Who is laksa lover can come and try here.. recommendation for laksa lovers
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: YF Lee
Review: I've been going to the coffee shop for the past few weeks either for bfast or lunch. They hv quite a variety of food on the menu. They r famous for their Laksa. Service was fast & the place is clean.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Xavier Lee
Review: I find their laksa quite special because of its thick broth. I wouldn't call this Sarawak Laksa, because many can comment that this isn't qualified to be 'Sarawak Laksa'. But it's one of those Miri shops that makes really good food. Their ‚Ä¶MoreI find their laksa quite special because of its thick broth. I wouldn't call this Sarawak Laksa, because many can comment that this isn't qualified to be 'Sarawak Laksa'. But it's one of those Miri shops that makes really good food. Their service is quick and efficient, their location is in town, perfect for tourists. They have fresh prawns, good portions and a reasonable price. I totally recommend the Mee Kolok Laksa, it' goes well together, it explodes in your mouth at every slurp. At only Rm7 you're in for an adventure.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: griMM JJAC
Review: Laksa tasted quite nice
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Chun-Yeow Yeoh
Review: Got at least 3 options: Sarawak Laksa, Kolo Mee and its varieties, fried mee and its varieties. The place is clean and got table service. Pay when your food is delivered. Laksa is the famous one and a bit pricey with RM8 for normal version. Kolo Mee costs RM3.50 only.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Sein Chyi Woo
Review: Laksa is very yummy and the portion is pretty generous! Go for the laksa and skip the kolo mee instead. I still like kolo mee at È∏øËøêËå∂È§êÂÆ§ better.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Duc Huy Nguyen (Pippi Peo)
Review: It is easy to find this restaurant in a corner near the shopping mall Imperial.The Kuching laksa here is delicious. You could decide to pick a normal bowl or a ‚Ä¶MoreIt is easy to find this restaurant in a corner near the shopping mall Imperial.The Kuching laksa here is delicious. You could decide to pick a normal bowl or a special bowl but I think the difference is only that special bowl has more prawns (but havingmore prawns are also good). Normal bowl costs 7 myr while the special one costs 9.But I personally do not like the taste of the mee sup here, because it is neither salty nor spicy.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Ms. Anita
Review: Simple and no-fuss food centre. No aircon, just fans, but if you're just going to have a quick meal, it's enough. Recommended food here would be the Sarawak Laksa and Sabah Beef Noodles. If you want rice, they serve a variety as well. You can either order the usual fried rice or order dishes to go with the rice.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Angela Jay
Review: The foods and drinks are delicious especially the Laksa Sarawak. One of the best! The prawn is big enough compares to other stalls. Make sure you try it!
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Ramesh ‚ÄúZimbo‚Äù Boonratana
Review: Two days in a row of my three days in Miri for the best Sarawak Laksa in Miri, and probably one of the best in Sarawak. Sarawak Laksa has a unique taste and set of flavors that tingles different parts of your tongue.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: James Tan
Review: Had a bowl of kolo mee(RM$3.50) and the called legendary kicking laksa (RM$7.00). And a Ice Milo (RM$3.50)Don't understand why the ice Milo is so expensive? It is the same price as the ‚Ä¶MoreHad a bowl of kolo mee(RM$3.50) and the called legendary kicking laksa (RM$7.00). And a Ice Milo (RM$3.50)Don't understand why the ice Milo is so expensive? It is the same price as the kolo mee.Where the legendary laksa is at RM$7.00(Normal type) The special is at RM$9.00.The taste of the laksa is unique though. As compared to Penang and Singapore laksa.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Chow PuPu
Review: Laksa are quite diluted but for when ever you are in Miri i think this place serve a ok Sarawak Laksa. Prawn not very fresh and too small.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Sin Toun Loh
Review: One of my favourite laksa place in miri. Special bowl cost you rm9 with extra fish balls and prawn. Ask for the kolo mee special!
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Sandro Nania
Review: Very good Kuching Laksa and Kolo mee. Prices are very affordable. Weekends and during lunch time is packed. You might need to wait to be seated.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: velyaang
Review: Very expensive, and the Laksa isn't as good as other restaurants, which are CHEAPER.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Ian Ng
Review: Small coffee shop but has the only two signature local dishes : Sarawak laksa and kolo mee. Very accessible from Imperial hotel.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Review: I prefer kolo mee over sarawak laksa. The price is more reasonable. The drinks here is simply too expensive and quality so so only.

Review: Delightful friendly service, warm hospitality & a wide variety of reasonably priced chicken cruisine - roasted, steamed, curry or tarayaki. Top up with dessert from ang tau peng to the house special - rich milk cendol. Wide selection of ‚Ä¶MoreDelightful friendly service, warm hospitality & a wide variety of reasonably priced chicken cruisine - roasted, steamed, curry or tarayaki. Top up with dessert from ang tau peng to the house special - rich milk cendol. Wide selection of drinks. Recommended  "c kosong" barley - sugarless barley drink for sugar-fearing diners.  Ample parking is available.

Author: Suzanne Archer
Review: Absolutely love the chicken here, roast as well as poached. It's the first establishment that I have been to that serves poached chicken cooked to perfection and to top it off, they have an amazing chili sauce that doesn't leave an after ‚Ä¶MoreAbsolutely love the chicken here, roast as well as poached. It's the first establishment that I have been to that serves poached chicken cooked to perfection and to top it off, they have an amazing chili sauce that doesn't leave an after taste in your mouth. If chili's not for you they have sambal belacan and a beautifully light ginger and garlic sauce.

Enjoying its signature mee jawa tulang come with the supercilious crispy fried chicken in the breeze of south china sea  which is just a ‚Ä¶MoreIt is simply a village stall by the road side of Kpg Pulo Melayu adjacent to the Miri Golf Course. Enjoying its signature mee jawa tulang come with the supercilious crispy fried chicken in the breeze of south china sea  which is just a stone‚Äôs throw from the stall. Operating from 7am till 3pm daily except Tuesday. Try also its specialities of fried noodle, fried kuehtiaw with meat or the crispy chicken wings. To top the delicious menu would be the tasty teh tarik...
Location: Kampung Pulau Melayu, Miri, Sarawak

Author: KK Pau
Review: Great Muslim food, colourful, spicy, aroma taste. Great coffee and tea full of fragrance. The location at Kampung Pulau Melayu experience the feel in the village. Beautiful green environment enjoy pleasant morning breeze. The Miri Golf Club ‚Ä¶MoreGreat Muslim food, colourful, spicy, aroma taste. Great coffee and tea full of fragrance. The location at Kampung Pulau Melayu experience the feel in the village. Beautiful green environment enjoy pleasant morning breeze. The Miri Golf Club is nearby. If lucky enough, we can see Hornbill birds at tree top. The beach is just a hundred meters away.
Location: Kampung Pulau Melayu, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Husniah Buang

Author: Raymond L.W. Tiong
Review: If you are the sort who are inclined to sit in a cafe to do some work or studying: its a cosy place with good wifi, lots of ports to charge your phone and laptop, nice selection of coffee and tea to keep you going, and a clean toilet for ‚Ä¶MoreIf you are the sort who are inclined to sit in a cafe to do some work or studying: its a cosy place with good wifi, lots of ports to charge your phone and laptop, nice selection of coffee and tea to keep you going, and a clean toilet for toilet visits. You can request a change of music genre or adjustment of volume from the staff.There are alot of board games to play and have tea with friends here.A decent regularly updated inventory of christian books that you can buy to add to your library.There is a limited selection of warm food for lunch:- whole roast chicken thigh with a generous helping of mash potato (highly recommended)- lasagna (portion bit on the small side, but still highly recommended)- spaghetti bolognese (so-so in my opinion but my wife n kids love it)- cream mushroom soup (highly recommended to get the big bowl and not the small bowl add-on)I'm not much for cakes, but the cakes are Holiday Inn Bakery grade. The waffle with dabai ice cream is to die for :) - order an add on scoop on the same receipt for a discount on the extra scoop :)
Location: Lot 2969, 1st Floor, Block 2, Phase 1 MCLD, Jalan Dato Sri Joseph Balan Seling, Jalan Pujut 7, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Jaime Leong
Review: Ordered aus Sirloin steak, medium rare. Repeated myself twice to server. When served it was well done. Told server i wanted it medium rare, they took it back thinking they would change it. Instead they COOK IT AGAIN and gave it back to me. ‚Ä¶MoreOrdered aus Sirloin steak, medium rare. Repeated myself twice to server. When served it was well done. Told server i wanted it medium rare, they took it back thinking they would change it. Instead they COOK IT AGAIN and gave it back to me. Now this time my steak was overcooked. Complained and all i get was "oh okay" and just walk off as if it never happened. Great job for a restaurant that serve western food. your staff cant even understand simple instructions bt how i want my steak being cook.Friends ordered chicken steak, fish cutlets and another chicken dish. All deep fried and too salty! Guiness was not fresh at all.Only decent thing was heneiken draught since is quite cheap during happy hours. The rest can skip.
Location: Lot 2065 & 2066, Ground Floor, Marina Parkcity, Phase 1, Miri, Sarawak

Author: rowland kebing
Review: "Lets be together and eat" is what "pahlung" is in Kayan. Served ethnic food varieties with reasonable price. "MU Stall" serving chicken & pork rice has its stall here. "MU Stall" had been in Lutong Baru for many years ... in the early ‚Ä¶More"Lets be together and eat" is what "pahlung" is in Kayan. Served ethnic food varieties with reasonable price. "MU Stall" serving chicken & pork rice has its stall here. "MU Stall" had been in Lutong Baru for many years ... in the early 1990's this was where I get my takeaway chicken rice. Still here today,  November 2020, is a testimony of its popularity among the nearby residents.
Location: Lutong, Sarawak

Author: Khairunnazren Ismail

Author: Chien Ya Su
Review: Four stars for Feed Me. I had the special of the day which was Nasi Kerabu and also snuck in a piece of fried chicken and sambal from my companion's Nasi Lemak. Loved the fish skins for my kerabu and the medley of raw veges are well thought ‚Ä¶MoreFour stars for Feed Me. I had the special of the day which was Nasi Kerabu and also snuck in a piece of fried chicken and sambal from my companion's Nasi Lemak. Loved the fish skins for my kerabu and the medley of raw veges are well thought out. I did  not feel like I was eating anything raw which was always going to be a challenge for me, but I knew it was healthy at the same time - two thumbs up! Prices are hefty (above RM15 per plate) but the portions are pretty big. It's also an order-at-the-counter place which is smart considering how packed they get during lunch. The only improvements I would say are needed are the service which can tend to be a bit slow eg for clearing tables even without having to take orders. Place is airconditioned - do not expect to sit around to have a chat as it gets crowded at lunch.
Location: Lot 3528, Ground floor, Al-Bayt Square Miri 101 Commercial Centre, Jalan Miri Pujut, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Donald J Joseph
Review: Remember how u want to wash your hands, but somehow the handsoap was too diluted that washing hands just futile? Not here. They gave their best, see the clean lavatory and full bodied hand soap. Feel clean afterwards. ‚Ä¶MoreRemember how u want to wash your hands, but somehow the handsoap was too diluted that washing hands just futile? Not here. They gave their best, see the clean lavatory and full bodied hand soap. Feel clean afterwards.Food, u say? My personal fav is the pork burger. Comes w special sauce. Give it a shot guys. Won't harm to try , isnt it?Booze? Yes. They have. ON THE TAP, lovely people. Guinness & Heineken. Size comes in ¬Ω pint (sadly no full pint).But that's all it takes. Pork & Booze. Way to live.
Location: L, Ground Floor, Lot 3494, S, 14, Jalan Piasau, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Benjamin Sebastian Raymond
Review: Four stars because of the portion they dish out. It's a little tucked away place that is somewhat barren but i guess thats a good thing since it will be quiet so that you can have a heart to heart talk with your friends over a platter of ‚Ä¶MoreFour stars because of the portion they dish out. It's a little tucked away place that is somewhat barren but i guess thats a good thing since it will be quiet so that you can have a heart to heart talk with your friends over a platter of delicious food. Drawback? Mosquitoes. But easily remedied by wearing insect repellent before heading there. Personally, I didn't experience any problems with the mosquitoes there since the establishment lights up insect repellent coils.
Location: L, Ground Floor, Lot 3494, S, 14, Jalan Piasau, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Ivan Ong T'sen Loong
Review: Not saying this out of bias-ness and all... but I do honestly think that for those who love coffee and thinking that Starbucks is too mainstream (which it is), this is the place to be. Small, comfy, not stuffy, good acoustics, good smell of ‚Ä¶MoreNot saying this out of bias-ness and all... but I do honestly think that for those who love coffee and thinking that Starbucks is too mainstream (which it is), this is the place to be. Small, comfy, not stuffy, good acoustics, good smell of coffee, blending in with the delicious smell and taste of cooking behind; ugh. it's the place to be!As a coffee lover myself, the blend they do here is amazing. I can even call a triple shot Latte and it stays "kicked" and even better taste with a little of thickness in the coffee. Best taste I have tasted so far in the Marina areas. No offense. =)Food is darn good, never failed to really tickle my tastebuds. woohoo. Loving the chefs behind who are young and also experienced. (but I really hope that they have more spaghetti next round. terlalu sikit la i think)Again, if you love some place to be just having a homely feeling, here it is. =)Sincerely, your fav customer. (cheh haha)
Location: Lot 2012, Ground Floor, Marina Parkcity, Lorong Marina 3/1, Phase 1, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Rui Foo
Review: Their popular roasted chicken was good. Served with coleslaw and mashed potato which were above my expectation. This is Rm25. My friends ordered meatball sandwich, chicken sandwich and tuna sandwich which were not bad. However,  the bread ‚Ä¶MoreTheir popular roasted chicken was good. Served with coleslaw and mashed potato which were above my expectation. This is Rm25. My friends ordered meatball sandwich, chicken sandwich and tuna sandwich which were not bad. However,  the bread was tooo crispy that made it difficult to cut. You can eat with your bare hands but it would be messy as the sandwiches were served without the sandwich wrapper.

Author: Gurjit Samra
Review: I went to Black Apron. It's the same place as Palate. Black Apron operates for brunch. I had the Grilled Chicken Salad and Buffalo Chicken Wings. For the salad, I would like it better if they left a bit of the skin of the chicken so I could ‚Ä¶MoreI went to Black Apron. It's the same place as Palate. Black Apron operates for brunch. I had the Grilled Chicken Salad and Buffalo Chicken Wings. For the salad, I would like it better if they left a bit of the skin of the chicken so I could taste the seasoning or marinade. The cook of the chicken was okay. Some parts were dry but the honey dressing on it compensated that. As for the wings, the batter was a bit on the thicker side. The flavour was decent. The buffalo sauce could've been better. It lacked that tang and spice that buffalo sauce should have. The staff was helpful and friendly. Overall could be improved.
Location: Lot 1954, Marina Parkcity, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Mel Nain
Review: Went here for NYE dinner. The waitress wasn't focusing on us when she is taking our order. She stopped taking our order halfway to entertain other new customers. Like can't she wait for a min for us to finish ordering our drinks? Then she ‚Ä¶MoreWent here for NYE dinner. The waitress wasn't focusing on us when she is taking our order. She stopped taking our order halfway to entertain other new customers. Like can't she wait for a min for us to finish ordering our drinks? Then she left us hanging for a good 10 mins, only then she continue taking our orders. She got my husband's order wrong & have to wait for 20-30 mins (all of our food is finished and my husband still hasn't got his food). The food was so-so, small portion but pricey. Gravy was a lil too salty for us. The fries is a no no (get a fatter ones since you are charging customers that expensive). A lot of improvements need to be done. Please, next time focus on 1 table and then next to the other. Don't leave customers halfway between their order. I find it so rude to be honest. Won't come here again. My first & last
Location: Lot 1954, Marina Parkcity, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Michael J
Review: Ambience is modern chic. Food was reasonably good, with the Fusion Ayam Pansoh Udon being something delitefully different. ‚Ä¶MoreAmbience is modern chic. Food was reasonably good, with the Fusion Ayam Pansoh Udon being something delitefully different.However, the dining experience was hampered by the poor counter staff service by some of the crew, hence the poor rating here mainly is for the service. Only 1 of the counter/cashier crew was courteous, the others needs serious courtesy and customer service training. Some of them look like the customers owe them a living, and prone to serious mistakes on billing. Triple check your bills.
Location: Lot 1954, Marina Parkcity, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Jamie Furlong
Review: I go for the pizza which, considering this is your standard simple Muslim restaurant, is actually not bad. The proprietor is a sharp lady who has a good sense of humour so service is efficient. We've been told the lobster is recommended but ‚Ä¶MoreI go for the pizza which, considering this is your standard simple Muslim restaurant, is actually not bad. The proprietor is a sharp lady who has a good sense of humour so service is efficient. We've been told the lobster is recommended but haven't tried it, but the local soups and noodles are good. Just wish they'd provide chilli oil or tabasco for my pizza instead of that horrible, sweet ketchup stuff. Good place to line the tum before hitting Beer O'clock opposite.
Location: Lot 1971 Marina Parkcity Phase 2, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Jobina Tym
Review: F&B - ordered Kueh tiaw and the portion was huge. Felt it was not salty enough. But the hot plate bean curd was good although the portion could be more and I‚Äôve had better ones at other places. In general, it‚Äôs quite good. ‚Ä¶MoreF&B - ordered Kueh tiaw and the portion was huge. Felt it was not salty enough. But the hot plate bean curd was good although the portion could be more and I‚Äôve had better ones at other places. In general, it‚Äôs quite good.Environment - can be quite packed if it‚Äôs full house. Also, noisy. It is air conditioned. Can be improve!Parking -plenty of free parking available.Service - quick service. Staffs were attentive.Price- quite reasonable for the portion given.It‚Äôs a nice place for lunch especially on a hot day since it is air cond. but definitely not a place you‚Äôd want to linger and talk. All in all, I‚Äôd come back again.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: C P Y
Review: Be careful to read each items in your receipt. Price in receipt is different from the price in the menu. Many people do not aware of what is being charged and just pay the total sum asked. Rip-off from the small details of the food ordered. ‚Ä¶MoreBe careful to read each items in your receipt. Price in receipt is different from the price in the menu. Many people do not aware of what is being charged and just pay the total sum asked. Rip-off from the small details of the food ordered.I ordered broccoli with mushroom: price written on the menu is RM12, but was charged RM25! When I asked the cashier why I was charged RM25 instead of RM12 shown in menu, they just simply answer that the price has increased. Ridiculous! Increase from RM12 to RM25!Very stingy in putting ingredients. The sea cucumber, fish maw and mushroom in the soup are cut into very small piece.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Marcus K.
Review: I give this place a high rating for simple but very delicious dishes.  My faves include the butter prawns, lemon chicken, sesame pork ribs, pork and preserved vegetable and also mixed vegetable that came with a spicy dusting of some kind. ‚Ä¶MoreI give this place a high rating for simple but very delicious dishes.  My faves include the butter prawns, lemon chicken, sesame pork ribs, pork and preserved vegetable and also mixed vegetable that came with a spicy dusting of some kind.   All good.They have a few beers available by the bottle including the Heineken family of beers.   Had an Anchor Smooth Draught.Lots of easy parking out front and surrounded by bars if you want to chill after eating a full meal.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: John Voon
Review: Fairly good spread of dishes. Food quality is variable. The dishes are quite tasty but do have quality issues. The king spareribs were overcooked and the black vinegar pork was tasty but no lean meat - only fat and skin. Service needs improving. Drinks were served incorrectly and one dish came out 30 mins later, after the meal.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Malcam Prasad
Review: The mee mamak was superp and the portions are great value. Their seafood is really fresh and doesn't have a fishy smell or funny taste. The price point is decent for their food and service. But they have 2 chefs that rotate shifts and one ‚Ä¶MoreThe mee mamak was superp and the portions are great value. Their seafood is really fresh and doesn't have a fishy smell or funny taste. The price point is decent for their food and service. But they have 2 chefs that rotate shifts and one is better than another. One has mediocre food and one has fantastic food. So try again if your first time was average.
Location: Miri, Sarawak

Author: Mohd Shahrizal ‚ÄúLord Stukka‚Äù Mohamed
Review: This is the best place for Nasi Lemak. I bought two Nasi Lemak with Sambal Paru, Sambal Sotong and Ayam Goreng together with Teh C Special as a drink. It has cost me around RM31. The price was reasonable. Their Nasi Lemak tastes good. I ‚Ä¶MoreThis is the best place for Nasi Lemak. I bought two Nasi Lemak with Sambal Paru, Sambal Sotong and Ayam Goreng together with Teh C Special as a drink. It has cost me around RM31. The price was reasonable. Their Nasi Lemak tastes good. I mean this is the correct way to produce Nasi Lemak because the fragrants is there and it is rich with flavours. I've read some of the comment below about this place. They've said that the Sambal or "Chili Paste Sauce" was too hot and spicy but I don't think it so. Because Sambal needs to be hot and spicy. After all, their Sambal spiciness is not that hot. I would say between it is at Level 4 between Level 1-10 spiciness. There's a variety of side dishes to choose from. This place offers dine-in and take away option as well as delivery via Foodpanda. All in all, I would like to recommend this place as a breakfast spot for travellers.
Location: Jalan Royal, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Tze Horng Tan
Review: Offers one of the best Malay foods in Miri. Do not miss the nasi lemak with the choice of various combinations. For the daring customer, the exotic and tentalising Nasi Kerabu is must try. It has the combination of various herbs and spices with an option of "rendang" chicken, roasted chicken and so on.
Location: Jalan Royal, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Jack Daniels

Author: Matthias Verron
Review: Nasi lemaks is the best here in town. Salam ku dolok!! Nasi lemak is come with varieties choice of chicken. But anyway the sambal is one of a kind. Oh yeah, kueh tiaw goreng also the thumbs up.

Review: My husband likes to eat nasi lemak every time he comes here. I would not say the nasi lemak is that really delicious, it is more to average and it is a bit expensive. The service is a bit slow because you have to queue and wait for others ‚Ä¶MoreMy husband likes to eat nasi lemak every time he comes here. I would not say the nasi lemak is that really delicious, it is more to average and it is a bit expensive. The service is a bit slow because you have to queue and wait for others to take their orders for to go or dine in. If they are ordering for to go, you have to be patient because they are packing the food a bit slow. My suggestion is the restaurant should provide two separate counters for to go and dine in.
Location: Jalan Royal, Miri, Sarawak

Author: NURATIKAH E. ABDULLAH
Review: Food ok. But very hot for me. I ordered nasi kerabu, sauce very hot. Cant really taste the ayam percik. Food ordering queue was so slow moving. New staff or just slow. No more. If i crave for their nasi lemak, i think i just order online.
Location: Jalan Royal, Miri, Sarawak

Author: Dyg Nurulashikin
Review: First of all, the food is good and it's affordable. But for nasi lemak it a little bit spicy perhaps SRS can make another sambal with less spicy so people can choose original or spicy sambal. The atmosphere is good. As for the workers who ‚Ä¶MoreFirst of all, the food is good and it's affordable. But for nasi lemak it a little bit spicy perhaps SRS can make another sambal with less spicy so people can choose original or spicy sambal. The atmosphere is good. As for the workers who serving the food at the counter, use hair cover so that others don't eat any worker's hair like i did. Take care of the cleanliness

Review: I ordered nasi lemak with ayam percik and paru plus iced lemon. Total rm15++. As a kuchingite it is very expensive considering the place is just like ordinary restaurant, no aircond and it's just a nasi lemak. How much is the nasi lemak ‚Ä¶MoreI ordered nasi lemak with ayam percik and paru plus iced lemon. Total rm15++.
